I had this game for a long time and could not quite get into it as the learning curve and grind was a little high initially. But I decided to stick with it, and it opened up like a flower. I'm glad I did as there is a lot of content, and quite good if basic gameplay mechanics. Simple things like being able to walk rather than run around like a sprinter in other games, to an option to have a full 24 hour day length cycle if you want it.

The learning curve and amount of grind early on is quite high, mostly as the tutorials don't completely explain what goes where well enough, although it does cover a lot of material you have to experiment a little. 

The performance is OK but does drop a little in places, and when map tiles load in. But it's a trade-off.

I've had a lot of fun trying to figure out the mechanics and how to get that dirt to pay out as efficiently as possible. I watched a couple of the Alaska gold digging episodes on TV recently, and nice to see this game is in the same vein. I love the fact you can buy land, survey it and dig up all the voxel dirt, with good machines that sound really great and can be operated in first and third person. 

The seasons have a good in game mechanic, so you need to operate different machines at different occassions to work the land depending on scarsity of water, and frozen earth. It's great that the vehicles can break down and a miriad of parts you have to purchase and install from time to time, really adds to the richness of the game, and reminds me of the TV episodes where they always seem to have something breaking down.

It would be nice to have placeable cameras (maybe buy go-pros at the shop!?) on vehicles so you can reverse and see a rear view monitor so you can stay in first person all the time, as reversing in some vehicles is not easy.

The game feels like it was made by people who really enjoyed making and playing it!

What I really like about this game is it is the good grind, it's a nice way to relax, you know?

ive had this since it came out. and it had an interest to me as something i could sit back and enjoy. at the time i was hoping that it would get multiplayer some point in the future. you have many aspects of the mine you have to manage on your own while making money for your employees, equipment, and repairs. when you get to later (end game) mining, you have a lot more you have to do at once like your diggers, dump trucks, drilling for core samples, your washplant, and much more. adding so many aspects to a game where you are one person running around on a single plot of land from one machine to another is an extremely time consuming process that takes up a lot of time you could be using to mine and make money.i could start new saves every time i start to go in the red, but that would honestly just kill the fun of the game. this game direly needs multiplayer support.

other end of my rant is a discovery channel based game is always going to have some form of competition to it as well. in this, they added in the leader boards so your competing against someone. what was a nice laid back mining game is now something that is no longer fun. again, this game needs multiplayer. without it, it is dead to me

When I first bought this game, I didn't really enjoy it as much as I'd expected. A couple years later I gave it another go and figured out why:

This game is about digging ditches to process the dirt you dig up. If you play this game for 3 hours in one day, that's a little under 3 hours spent digging ditches. Strangely that's still a far more engaging activity than what a lot of triple-A titles give for you money, but it's incredibly monotonous.

Compare the game to the Farming Simulator games and you can see the flaws: Spend 50 hours in FS and you have a wide range of farm vehicles, multiple fields, and plans for how to efficiently sow, grow, and harvest those fields. Then on top of that you might have cows, sheep, and of course your chickens.

Spend 50 hours in Gold Rush and you'll have yet another digging machine with yet another washing machine to dump your dirt into. Also a giant ditch in the ground dug by yours truly.

I have over 120 hrs playing this game, It has some real neat things about it, However I could not recommend it because of it's down falls. It has no ability for multiplayer. It gets a bit lonely playing alone all the time. Second the advancement in the game is just simply not there, after you set up the first major processing plant, its the same old thing, digging never gets faster or less labor intensive and then processing gets just a little better as the game progresses.  Hired workers are worthless. A player can hire workers and all they do is swap mats or fill buckets from the equipment. Hired workers are also expensive to have and do almost nothing for you.  The  game became a major grind. I can fill a truck but then even if I have a driver for the truck I still have to drive it to the sluice. The player must still do all the digging, transporting, gold refining, gathering of buckets to do clean-outs. its just a major grind. Sure workers slow down the rate at which things break and workers increase efficiencies but I can not assign anyone to put gas into my equipment again its a grind. I would rather enjoy a team effort or an AI player that I could hire to work along side of me.  For those reasons I can not recommend this game. sorry folks...

Do I recommend this game? Well, to put it simply? No. Not at all. IF you need a quick answer that's it. 
If you want to read me complain about what you MIGHT experience, read further sure.

So, I played this game like 2 years ago, when it was a bad beta that got a lot of people to experience a ton of bugs, I was using an RX 440 with 2gb of VRAM, and you know what? It run at a sucky 50 fps, but it run smooth except of course for each loading screen you get every 30 secs from driving anywhere, since that isn't processed in any loading screen it seems. 
So, how does it run now that I have 16GB of DDR4 RAM with a speed of some cool 2600 MHZ, an I5 7500K and an RX 5500 XT 4GB? Well, *EVEN WORSE*, don't ask me how dude, devs couldn't even explain I betcha (if they are even still responding for this excuse of game). 
Game freezes out of nowhere, I bought it with all the DLCS it had, and it runs like butter, until it freezes 20 mins into the game, so, I did what any sensible smart techy guy does!
I updated graphics drivers, I did as devs told by installing some visuals and I tried lowering graphics and disabling everything graphical that could be disabled... I am laughingly happy to announce that this solved my issue! From 20 mins into the game freezing, I gained 5 minutes more! So game keeps freezing with everything updated and visuals reinstalled... I was about to ask for the refund having 1.9 hours on the game. Butcha know what? I didnt try reinstalling! Silly ole me. I will try that, its probably the issue.
I did,
It keeps doing it. 
I dug deeper into solutions since now I had reached 2.5 hours of game time, read about 18 cases similar and none with solution either from devs or from users.
Is it a fun game? Yeah, but dont worry, it keeps itself from having you hooked in it and wasting your life on it. Props to the "devs" if someone who makes a game like this can be called so.

Game is just okay. Lots of little annoying things. Many plants/rocks along the road have massive hit boxes so you will hit them randomly. The loading freezes are frequent. some areas as you enter them you will get back to back loading freezes. vehicle and foot travel over the ground is wonky. slight hills can be almost impossible to climb. the bull dozer is virtually useless. to return a rented piece of equip it must be on your claim but you are only allowed one machine at first. so if you have two machines and want to save money and return one, you need to pay to have it transferred to the claim to then return it and start saving money. Vehicles dont have brakes, instead you use reverse to stop or use the E brake to slide stop. Since its reverse and not brakes stopping is very slow, stopping while reversing is even slower and if you are on a hill and your engine is off the "brakes" do not work at all. Gold percentage is broken for claims. Had 21oz of gold with a 45% cut going to claim lease. Cut was taken and i was left with 7.9oz of gold. Yepp thats def 45% of 21... This game could have been really cool if a better team developed it, or if they just put more effort into it.

I can't recommend this game and it sucks. Love the TV show, watched it religiously for a long time and was very excited to hear about a Gold Rush game (I have had the game since close to release but I waited to play it because of how bad it was). Such a terrible game, easily in the top 5 of my worst ever played games. I have no idea what the dev company were thinking when they decided to slap the name of Gold Rush onto a game, then make the only thing about the show the main menu images and the music. Get into the game and you are basically doing all the tedious, monotonous BS that they thought was too boring for the show, so whoever thought "we can make that into a game" has no business in gaming.
3 difficulties. Easy, where everything costs $1 and you can't fail, ever. The only good thing about easy is you get the snap mode for placing machinery, more on that in a minute. Medium difficulty could have been a good difficulty but they decided that the snap machinery placement should just be an easy difficulty. Another of the numerous mistakes made by this dev company. Hard i'm not even bothering with. The machinery snap should just always be a thing since the game is optimised so poorly that 1 of many things could happen. You could get a massive piece of machinery caught on a small gas tank, ya know, the one's usually stored in a car, which will snap all your cables. Or, maybe, it will try saving or loading (for the millionth time in a minute) which goes on to crash your game after an hour of trying to place machinery on a game developed by morons. Then, the icing on the cake, the devs think they have done such a good job, they think, "let's get more money and give them some crap DLC before even thinking about fixing our game". And there was much rejoicing... NOT!
0/10 - I'd have spent my time better slowly peeling my own nose off.

UPDATED AS OF 11-25-21

First, I will give my personal opinion on this game. Pros, cons, and some interesting update ideas for game play will be listed below. 

Opinion: This is a super fun game, but it takes a LONG time to get massive amounts of gold. It could also be that I'm just playing it wrong. I love that you are in full control of the machinery and other objects. You can also place stuff where you most desire (unless its something that NEEDS to go in a certain spot). The game might look boring, but really, it is super fun. With SO MUCH to explore, you can spend a LONG time collecting all the story pieces for the journal and finding hidden secrets. There really is not much of a story line itself, but the journal stories take care of that. I REALLY find the journal helpful. It shows what everything is and how to get it, but unfortunately, it does not show certain steps for using different objects on the Tier 3 set up.  

The stuff that really annoys me is placing the Tier 3 gold mining equipment. You have to use the big excavator to haul the equipment to its proper location, and some of the pieces are extremely hard to place with the excavator because the equipment pieces have to be in the right direction and sometimes there is just no good way to properly place a certain piece. 

Pros: 

- Graphics are really good even with them on low (but obviously the higher the graphics level, the higher the graphics will be)
- Game is very realistic (minus placement of mining equipment ~ stuff doesnt just "snap" into place in real life)
- I do like the fact that stuff can break and you have to replace it. Sometimes this can get annoying though. 

Cons:
- The game seems to lag hardcore when crossing the tracks to get to the blacksmith. (does anyone else have this issue?) 
- There are no other cars or people in the towns. (is this because this places are abandoned?)
- there is one area you cannot access and for some reason it really bothers me... 
- you cannot explore the insides of buildings or houses which is disappointing. You can go UP TO some of them, but not inside. 
- HOW DO YOU GET THE WORKERS TO ACTUALLY MAKE GOLD!?!?!?  seems to be a 'bug' in the game where workers dont make any money for you... but more likely, I just haven't figured it out yet... 

Update ideas:

- add people (citizens, police, firemen, EMT's, etc) and cars to the roads. (yes, i know there are a few cars in the towns, but they dont MOVE anywhere) 
- will the roads that are currently closed, ever be open?
- open up the area that annoys me that you cant enter... I feel like some crazy good exploring could happen at that location. (I'll give the location once I play the game again).
- make several building explorable and maybe add some hidden treasures like gold that was left behind from a previous miner. 
- I think exploring a gold mine (with hidden treasures of course) would be a great update to this game.
- WHY IS THE TRUCK (and other machinery) NOT UPGRADABLE!? A lot of the machinery could use MAJOR upgrades like strength and speed (half the time, im moving at 1mph or less with the big excavator). The truck needs to be upgraded BIG TIME ~ more speed and power when going up hills...     
- I know this isnt a fishing game but sometimes, i just want to take a boat out on the water and do some fishing in my spare time.

TL;DR - Games fine for what it is, lack of content makes it a bore after a while.

So the basic idea behind the game is to start small panning for gold. then use the money to make from that to buy bigger and better equipment, as well as new plots. The game does this very well, even with a few bugs here and there. It has a very easy learning curve, as well as not going some disgusting grind fest where it will take you 10 years to get some new equipment.

The visuals are solid, it's by no means a AAA looking game, but it's also not some half done rushed mess like some other games.

The controls are great, though I would recommend using something like a game pad as the two sticks really make operating equipment like the excavators a whole lot easier, and a whole lot more fun. It can be done with the keyboard, but I don't find it quite as nice.

Sound, eh, is what it is. It's not going to murder your ears, but again, it's not AAA quality.

Overall the game itself is great. My negative recommendation comes from the real lack of content and support. The game is essentially dead apart from a silly seasonal leader board, which is always filled with cheaters who somehow manage to mine silly amounts of gold, miles ahead of everyone else, who are pretty much neck and neck in the race to win.

It also really has a lack of replay value, you essentially play the same way every time. You can change it up slightly, but for the most part it's the same. Also, once you've unlocked the equipment, you basically have no real need to buy the other plots and set up all of the exact same equipment on that plot. You can setup all of the top equipment on the very first plot you get if you really wanted. 

All and all not bad, but not great. If you find it on sale during one of the steam seasonal sales, I would probably get it, if not, I wouldn't waste the money.

Where to start!  I really love Gold Rush the series.  So being able to take a trip to Alaska and look for gold from the comfort of my home has been amazing.  I have only played for about 6 hours but in that time I have fallen in love with this game and it sets in my top 20 all time favorites.  I love all the equipment and detail that has gone into this game.  And as with most guys I love the idea of driving heavy machines and playing in the dirt.  The only Con I can give this game is that the parcels that you can mine are limited.  I would love for the ability for all the land to be destructible so we could clear out and make our own roads for our heavy machinery IE cutting trees and grading like in the real show.  But over all the concept of this game are amazing.  There are tons of equipment to mess around with and the electricity and fluids management are very detailed and true to life.  If you need to power a work light just buy you one of several generators available for purchase fill it with fuel from a jerry can and plug in a drop cord and boom you can work at night!!!  This game has been out since 2017 and I am sad that I am just now buying it.  So if you are looking for a fun game to kill time and the ability to make it big with gold then check out  this game.  I mean what are you waiting for why are you still setting there reading my review click buy already!!!!!!!  No need to read any further you wont be disappointed!  And don't forget to get the Frankenstein machinery DLC it is well worth it.

This game has potential...  I like the economics and the machinery, it's all done really well, and getting more and more gold is strangely addictive.  It is decently well polished, though the performance was pretty bad on higher graphics settings, which are pointless because the graphics are 10 years old.

I get that multiplayer was too big an overhaul, but... not even an NPC at the cash register?  You can hire "workers" but they are a huge disappointment.  They can't use vehicles, transport things, or get anything useful done besides swapping out wash plant buckets.  It's like they're just teasing you with the idea that you might not have to do absolutely everything yourself by hand...  Because you do.  They don't even exist in the game world-- only on your tablet-- which doesn't work during storms. Huge disappointment.

Let me re-iterate that last point.  You cannot access your workers - on site - during a storm.
Huge.  Disappointment.

All that being said, I strangely keep coming back to it.  It's relaxing and slow-paced.  It's a grind for sure... but it's satisfying.  You just want to keep upgrading your equipment, buying new machinery, and running more of that sweet, sweet paydirt.

Please bare with me this is my first ever steam review on a game ever. So grammar maybe bad and there may not be perfect punctuation. But this a heartfelt review on a game.

Me personally I really enjoy this game for what it is. I personally will play this game because I got it for so cheap cause it was on sale. But I can't in my right mind tell other people to go buy this game. What is the first thing you think of with Gold Rush the TV show? Teamwork to achieve the goal of getting gold. Everyone working together. Guess what this game has no multiplayer and the developer has stated they will not put the work in to add multiplayer.

They hold a unique License to a one of a kind game there is no other game like it on the market. They are being literally like EA is with their Sports Licenses. No innovation while they have collected their money from the license. They have made enough I am sure to rewrite the code to fix the multiplayer issue. The game also suffers from severe bad optimization which causes real bad FPS drops. I will now break down Pro's and Con's for the skimming type.

-Pros

-You do feel like your on the show but solo
-Journal is a very good guide to help a new player
-Digtube which is their like video guide is very informative
-Its fun to put the time in to build an actual processing mine
-It is a good time waster to sit back and chill
-Leader Board atleast gives you some kind of multiplayer feel with prizes

-Cons

-Poor optimization which leads to crashes or fps drops ( I have not crashed but suffered fps drops)
-Trying to do everything solo is overwhelming
-They will not add multiplayer
-Placing mining set ups are very hard on some maps and that gets frustrating
To few maps
-There is no point to play anything other than leader board
-New content is very few and far between
-All they add are new cosmetic skins
-No new equipment
-Once you drill its hard to locate where you have drilled to get the good paydirt
-Clean up is horrible solo
-Water to run machines is scarce

I play and will continue to play for a while but new people unless you get this on deal I wouldn't bother because its not what people think this game should be. Maybe at some point a new concept will come along and the license will get awarded to someone else.
I love the game over all, I just think it's a bit too laggy for my $10,000 PC to handle and If my $10,000 PC Can't handle it I don't know what I can do.

The game is good, if you like something simple and repetitive to just kinda zone out while doing. Despite the developers saying it'll never come, multiplayer would make this game 1000 times better, it's definitely the type of game me and some friends would sit down and play for hours on end. Wouldn't personally buy at it's normal price but it's a good $10 game if you snag it while it's on sale. Overall 7/10.

Narrow niche game that will test your patience. Just like real gold mining, no fortune is earned through one session, sometimes even one season. If you like the idea of spending lots of hours mining for gold, then this is a good time sink for you. A lot of interesting mechanics that will keep you busy. Sadly developers seem to not be interested in adding more content even if it was in a form of DLCs... After you get all there is to have, theres not really a reason to stay playing or try different stuff. If they added more machine variety that would make this game next level, but it is still worth it as it is.

Look its alright, but a polish on graphics and performance would be one the best things that could happen to this game. You can have the best specs ever but that lack of polish still gives you massive frame drops at times. Also a change on progression and how fast it happens i would say needs a rework, because just to even progress a decent rate you need to have gold nuggets on, otherwise you will spend hours at the hogpan. The game is addictive but extremely slow unless gold nuggets are on. Some in game mechanics would also need to be reworked, as the with the repair function not every part can be replaced, only some, eg. only two out of the four tires can be changed on trailers and only one piston on the dump rock. That does make no sense, which is why i think it needs a rework. Some parts also need to be replaced too soon, because four cycles with the tier 3 wash system shouldnt make the wash plants pumps break. I would give this game a medium reccomendation if i could, because i would only buy this game if its on sale because of the lack of polish and almost seemingly unfinished mechanics.

I have 18 workers that want a job but none that drive things like the excavator. It would be nice if I could dictate were they go... The journal does not tell what part is what. You have to go to the machine place to get info.. I would also like a little cabin instead of a pathetic trailer that I could actually go into and sit and rest and enjoy my riches. After all this is Alaska

I have really enjoyed this game. Several times in playing I remarked, "seriously.. that much?" I said this because the detail, physics, and game play are exceptional. The pacing for unlocking tiers, and guide book make the game extremely enjoyable. It is understandable why there is no multiplayer, the mechanics and systems are complex and focus on the player/world perspective to function. The engine also.. is extremely poor. You will experience bugs, you will experience frame rate drops, you will experience lag. The good news is nothing so far, is game breaking. Most of the issues are memory leaks or memory load errors which upon rebooting the game are resolved completely. I am entranced by this simulator and will keep playing it until I feel complete.

Okay so I am going to be 100% honest about this game. I will first do a 1 out of 10 review and afterwards a reason and opinion.

Graphics: 5/10
Optimization: 4/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Variation: 6/10
Content: 4/10

So this is roughly my opinion in numbers. Anywyas, we all probably know that this game is poorly optimized and that it needs a lot of work to make it even a little smooth. But apart from that I enjoy the game. It has some fun machinery I like to use, you can upgrade some parts and replace them. The damage option is sadly not random so things just break by a durability bar. The fact that you need to grind is also nice. BUT after a while I noticed something pretty nice that will never happen in real life. The drill. With the drill you can basically farm unlimited gold by drilling 16 holes in every single square in normal mode. Within a hour I earned roughly 500k from just drilling. Yes it is boring. But yes I can now finally buy the machines instead of renting them forever.

Overall I would recommend this game if you don't mind the lag and low fps and some point. 

I would rate this game a 7 out of 10. :)

I gave this game the benefit of the doubt in the form of over 100 hours of my life I will never be able to get back. If you have an Nvidia RTX graphics card, prepare for stuttering and frame rates dropping down into the single digits at times. At this point, this game is abandonware and the developers have done absolutely nothing in nearly two years to fix the issues the game has been plagued with since it was release or added any new content. Unless you get this for free, stay away and stay away from Code Horizon, who cannot handle criticism of their faulty product that’s a pure money grab.

Drilling machine makes the entire game utterly pointless.  About halfway thru your very first day on normal difficulty, you have enough cash to rent the drill machine.  In the first 30 real minutes of drilling you get enough nuggets to buy a full level 3 setup.  Since that is a literally infinite supply, that only leaves the quest for magnetite in order to make the blacksmith transactions more efficient.  So, in short, after 30 minutes of real play time, the only reason you ever even consider actually digging dirt out of the ground is to get magnetite to make the drilling machine more efficient in your infinite supply of gold.

And hard mode is for sadists.  It's too bad the balance is so wacky, as the premise of starting small and forging a mining empire has significant allure.  Unfortunately, the most efficient way to build your mining empire is to never mine anything at all after the first half hour.

Code Horizon seems intent on thinking that adding common place features in most games such as Leader boards, and Difficulty Selection, to Gold Rush: The Game as "improvements"... All while ignoring the glaringly bad optimization, bugs, physics, and a community crying out for fixes, or multiplayer, or a release of the modding strangle hold they currently have over this game...

This all started in response to the known Troll, Metallios, saying I've helped no one and that I was being "disruptive" for pointing out that a change of Code Horizons EULA would be all that is needed to allow modding this game. My response was to say "Pot meet Kettle" then go on to point out that changing the EULA is what we where talking about before he brought up some crap about leader boards... So after I tired of pounding Metallios with true logic, and coming to the realization that he was just looking to start an argument. I deleted all my posts responding to Metallios, blocked him, and stated such. Then, I went through the entire thread and reported every post where Metallios was obviously looking to start an argument for "Trolling, Inciting Arguments." Then proceded to move on with my life.

About 7 hours ago I received a warning on the post declaring my intent to no longer engage the known troll Metallios, with "Disrespectful Post" attached.

A minute after receiving that, I was banned with my response to CaveMonkey's reply to an earlier post of mine asking "In hindsight, do you think 80% of the player base got scammed because I sure as ♥♥♥ do.." my response being "I Don't Disagree." Attached to this was "False Reports"

One of Metallios' trolling, and argumentative, posts is now "Marked as the answer to the topic above."

You smell that? Go ahead, take a good deep breath. You know what that is? That's Favoritism you smell. Where a trolling, foaming at the mouth, rabbid fanboy gets rewarded. And anyone who doesn't agree, and uses the base logic of a 9 year old to poke holes in Code Horizon's reasoning, gets the ban hammer. Yep, that's fair.

And just so you understand. Here's my rigs specs:

CPU: AMD A8-7600 APU clocks at 3.1GHz but I've seen it turbo to 3.8GHz
RAM: 32 GB of DDR3
GPU: Radeon R9 380X with 4GB of VRAM 

Now, here goes nothing...

For the pros (gonna be short):

1. The game is quite beautiful.

2. You get to drive/operate big machines.

3. You get to dig in dirt for gold, to buy more big machines.

4. It's very calming.

See, told you it'd be short. Now for the cons... I hope you got your reading hat on:

1. "The game is quite beautiful." Or it would be if the game wasn't so horribly optimized that you'll bottom out the graphics trying to combat the low fps, I'm talking low 20's consistently.

2. "You get to drive/operate big machines." The more of these you have, the worse your fps get.

3. "You get to dig in dirt for gold, to buy more big machines." Uh yeah, doesn't help the fps any...

4. "It's very calming." Or it would be if the physics weren't a janky mess. Walk into something immobile, you're stuck. You'll have to move away from the offending object to go anywhere, no wall grinding for you! Go to take a slight turn in the truck at speed, pull instant 180. And so much more, but on to the important stuff...

5. The team at Code Horizon does not listen to it's community. More on this soon.

6. This game is fully released, and marked as complete... Seriously, I'm not joking...

7. No Multiplayer in a Unity based game? Are You Nuts?!?!? Yeah you heard right, this game was made using Unity and there where No Plans to have/add multiplayer. The community (see told you there'd be more on this) has REPEATEDLY asked for multiplayer to be added, and Code Horizon made a pinned discussion here on steam for us to talk about it. 

Their response was:
"We here at Code Horizon know that the community would love to have Multiplayer as part of the game. Unfortunately, it’s not possible for us to implement without rewriting 50% of the game. Instead, we’re continuously working on other features." 

I'm sorry, do what? Did you say: "Sorry, but we're to lazy and incompetent to put work into our product." that discussion has since been locked so no one could continue the discussion of multiplayer implementation into the game.

With a final reply from Code Horizon of:
"The end has come for this thread as almost every possible question has been asked and answered.

Thanks to those that kept it civil and contributed to some good discussions.

Please direct anyone to this thread for them to look through if they need anything answered about MP and please do not post any MP threads on the forums.

Thank you." *shaking my head* More Can Always Be Said, You just got tired of listening to/interacting with your community...


8. Okay, no multiplayer, that's fine. How about modding support? 

In a Discussion on here their response to the question of modding support was:
"modding the game the way people are wanting to mod it will be a huge task and not worth pursuing hence why no one has bothered. If the game is not open to modding then there is no point trying." 

Okay, so let me get this straight. You made a game in Unity, one of The Most MODDABLE Game Engines On Earth With MULTIPLAYER FUNCTIONALITY Built Right Into The Unity Engine And DO NOTHING With Ether Of Those Options Available To You?

*speechless with dumbstruck look in face, brain says "make words happen" mouth says "ERROR: Does Not Compute" drools instead*

9. Okay Death, just breathe buddy, it'll be okay. How about allowing modding of the game with out support from you guys?

Code Horizons response has been EDIT(10/22/2019): To Me:

From: Codehorizon_Mod_Community

"Unfortunately, due to the extensive amount of code, that would have to be rewritten to allow modding, we are not able to implement such feature."

A falsehood (*cough* lie *cough*) that is constantly being force fed to the community at large...

In conclusion:
Well you've read this far, why not add my own thoughts to this. Although I suppose I already have XD...

Most, if not all of, the problems listed in the cons section of this review could easily be fixed by a modding community that is chomping at the bit to get at this game. But since Code Horizon does not allow modding of the game, it seems they never will get the chance to improve on the base of this game. Which is surprising to me, considering this is billed as a simulation game. And as far as I know, the only simulation game released in the past four years that does not allow modding in any form...

If you have nothing better to do, and already own the game, then this is an excellent time suck. 
That's why I have 200+ hours in game, that and dreaming of mods and multiplayer while playing, looking at the dump truck I'm filling with the excavator going 

"If we had mods, I'd have a multiplayer mod enabled. A friend would be in that dump truck, with another friend in a second dump truck, and a third running the wash plant... *sigh* oh well..."

And for the reasons listed in the cons section of this game, I cannot currently recommend this pitiful game. 

If Code Horizon comes to it's senses, and adds multiplayer, or allows the modding community to finally do their thing, I may change my recommendation...

EDIT(10/22/2019): Although I seriously doubt this money grubbing, greedy, and pitiful excuse for a "Game Studio" will do anything even close to coming anywhere near logical sense... Save your cash for Kerba Space Program 2, Or any Farming Simulator made by Giantz

Thanks for reading, Sincerely,

At this point in time I think it's well established that this game will not be getting multiplayer/coop. Which is a shame because that would have provided longevity and frankly more interest in the game. I think I read somewhere that the dev said they would have to rewrite 50% of the code to make this possible. Personally, I think they should just bite the bullet and DO IT. Easier said than done to say the least.

I could gripe about the fps drops, poor optimization, etc. But eventually they will either iron this stuff out or they will scrap it and make a new game. This will probably be the best route for them at this point if they ever want to make a game they can actually be proud of. 

That's about all I've got for negatives. To some, that's enough not to buy the game. So don't buy it.

However, I am going to keep playing it. I accept the game for what it is, flaws and all. To what some call boring, tedious, and repetitive- I call peaceful. This is just one of those games I can zone out in and relax. This coming from a person who gets frustrated and irritated (just like dealing with my ex wives) and in a lot of other games. This one just lets me fix equipment, dig, and solve problems. It's simple, but challenging enough so that I don't get bored. 

To increase the "fun" level and the reason I have played so many hours- I have my equipment controls on a HOTAS and I have a heavy equipment controller clamped to my desk as well. It makes it loads more enjoyable. As a side note, I have many hours of IRL experience running heavy equipment and I am now permanently disabled. So although I may never run equipment IRL again, this game gives me a small nugget of joy that I once felt.

[b][u]Updated 07/08/21[/u][/b]

Having recently come back to the game after a 3 year hiatus and therefore re-learning all the mechanics - I have some new observations: :MightyMiner:

  - The new flow and length mechanics are nice additions, as are the weather FX and draught 
    features.  The overall feel of the game is still very barren and apocalyptic though.

- The Loader still needs some love, under powered for the most part. :MightyLoader:

- More machinery options, higher horsepower and bigger excavators perhaps as
either DLC or unlocked via in-game goals (preferably the latter). :MightyBulldozer:

- Some more upgraded pickup truck options (think Dodge RAM Super/Heavy Duty or
Prospector). We really need a larger bed for that rigid crate storage to be meaningful.

- As above - ability for crates to be both rigid inside trucks as well as contain rigid item placeholders inside them - i.e. like buckets on the gold processing machinery. The toppling tower of hoses and motors is a bit much for even those withTetris levels of patience...

- For any newer players - options for weather warnings of incoming heatwaves or cold
weather/storms - Sometimes we get so engrossed in mining we forget to check the
temperatures..a beep or flash banner would work. I now plan for these with tankers but a
lesson learned.

- Some actual physical AI around town, be it either static in the store or a few wandering
around, the place is an apocalyptic looking ghost town. Would also love to see the AI workers at the claim, even if its simple AI that have repair animations or look to be working on machinery. 

I'm really hopeful of a sequel with an updated engine and AI characteristics with much more physicality and of course that elephant in the room....multiplayer/Co-op (I would happily settle for local coop mode).  


Edited  comments 24/11/18.

A fantastic game/franchise idea for a niche sim player base seriously ruined by Dev/publishers rushing to release an unfinished product.
This is very early alpha at best and [b][u]NOT a finished product[/u][/b].  Where is the checks by Valve for this stuff?  This should be an early access title!
[/i]24/11/18 - Still accurate.[/i]

Memory leaks, lack of vsync, unrealistic physics and hit boxes....terrain deformation, vehicle power, day/night cycle.... all need to be seriously worked on if the player base is to stay.
[i]24/11/18 - Vsync and physics are still an issue.[/i]

All of the above leads to random, frustating crashes which resets any progress made since your last save as ALL saves are MANUAL!  Completely ridiculous not to have auto-save implemented in a modern game.
[i]24/11/18 - Less crashes and auto save time now better.[/i]

I'd make a case for co-op or multiplayer support, but as it stands the game is so broke that in its current state its simply not feasible.
[i]24/11/18 - Should have had co-op support by now, currently a lot of setup work required by one person before you get to the nitty gritty of digging.[/i]

Such a shame that the Dev's support is so poor now they have the cash in their pockets.  The game is fun to play even with all of its bugs, it's a satisfying game to chill and play with a beer.  It's just not £15.49 satisfying.

[u]Buy this only when all of these bugs are fixed and Devs actually release statements of any worth, otherwise get used to an alpha experience.[/u]
[i]24/11/18 - Game is now a fair price at less than £10.00.[/i]

[i]@Devs Have a look at Spintires to find a realistic representation of small studio surpassing itself.  All be it not a perfect game but still more polished and with fantastic physics and vehicle power/weight.[/i]

[i]Edit: 22/11[/i]

Latest patch adds little info as to changes made e.g. fuel model and $1 purchase of machines.
Sceptic in me thinks they're treating paying customers as QA testers; something you wouldn't really associate with a supposed full release title. 

Still a massive problem with memory leaks and FPS goes as low as 6 FPS while using big excavator! (i have a Geforce 980ti).  Seriously unoptimised.  The dirt is also still bugged when moving it using front loaders and bulldozers, T3 almost beyond tiresome to work with and reasons to keep shifting paydirt now dwindling due to the above.

[i]Edit: 24/11/18[/i]

Now more options for dig sites, new machines and equipment, all be it through paid for DLC, which i thought should be much cheaper or even part of the original game.

Changes made to gold smelter is interesting, finding 'stories' around the map to add perks to the smelting encourages exploration outwith the dig site going to town and back.  It will take a while though before you see a return on this.

Object collision issues are still very annoying, e.g. gates and fences snagging trailers or walking and being stuck in a small hole or dirt pile.

The weather/seasonal system is very welcomed and gives you more of a feel of actual gold digging seasons.  Not sure if the dirt changes properties from winter to summer with permafrost etc.

Equipment damage is realistic and linked to the weather.  It makes you think what spares to grab from town or put on order for delivery to claims for a small premium.

As mentioned above, the game would be much easier and fun in co-op with friends.  Unsure why the developers can't do this.  Even local hosting would be acceptable.  Even though the game is extremely fun, it's just needing this badly.

This is a game concept I really enjoy so it is disaponting that I am not able to recomend this game. 
There are simply too many flaws in the game for it to reveal it's potenial. 
Graphics and movements are clunky and vehicle handling is simply a disaster... but if you realy enjoy simulator games you could push past that and enjoy the game. 
What really ruins the game experience for me is that the pay dirt is always the same in each spot. 
To explain, in "Hard" you never get any nuggets, they are not VERY rare... no, they are turned off and locked in the game settings... this added to the fact that the pay dirt is always the same,  each pan is the same !
You get roughly the same amount of gold in each pan ! Never an empty pan and never a good pan.
There is simply never any suspense, exitement or disapointment when you pan as each pan will contain roughly the same amount of gold each and every time. 
You can acctually calculate how many pans the bulldozer will cost you, this is game breaking for me and the game quickly becomes repetitive and predicable. 
Sure there are different quality digging sites but once you dig once you know excacltly how much each pan in this spot will yeld.

In conclusion, a good concept with poor game mechanics and a failed fun factor. 

Buy only if you dont mind the repetion and/or agree that pay dirt that yelds an average of 26 onzes per bucket should yeld exactly that every single bucket. 
I will admit that I did like the game untill I realized this and started calculating prices in number of pans instead of gold or dollars !!!

This is a game for a very specific type of player. If you just want to sit down and relax while mining some gold, then you might like it. Personally it's not really my cup of tea, it feels a bit too grindy and gets boring after a while. It makes you feel like a gold miner, but do you really [i]want[/i] to feel like one?

The actual gameplay has that sort of undescribable PlayWay janky feel. If you've played a playway game you know what i mean. The driving mechanics are janky to say the least. The town the game is based in feels completely dead and lifeless, even for Alaska. There's also a not insignificant amount of frame loss when driving from one part of town to another.

Most of what you'll be doing involves digging up soil with the excavator, putting it in the wash plant, repeating for 20 or so times, extracting the gold from what it spits out, selling the gold, repeating 20 or so times until you can afford a new machine, etc.

10 bucks isn't bad for what you're getting if you think you'll like the slow paced relaxing style this game has but you may want to consider spending it on something else instead if you don't.
The game is Fun when you accept some Loading time while Driving or FPS drops, its really not optimized well, at least I couldn't find any Bugs or glitches.

While I really want to like this game, it is very hard to. It seems to have been over a year since the last new actual content (no skins or workshop for skins does not count in my book). There is also a large part of the player base that want Multiplayer or at least Co-op to come to the game. Most crew on the show have multiple people for operations this size and that's not well represented in the game. I would even be OK with a better AI system to set a route for a few dump trucks to drive from the cut to the wash plant. My biggest issue is they spent all this time moving on to consoles before exploring game play that the entire community wants and could benefit from.

I bought this game a couple weeks ago on my console...   I wanted to play at work and I like the game so much that I bought it again for pc. If you think that you would like that, don't hesitate.  Do yourself a favor and don't do the $1 for everything.  The game is so much more fun when you have to work for the next tier of equipment. If you like digging..... you'll love this game.

I love the show. And i was exited for the game. The price was too high so i got it on sale.
I didnt expect too much and the first visual impression is not that good. But when u get startet and want to earn ur fist gold its fun and exiting. 

Fun if u play with nuggets. But after some time, checking all stuff in the shops and making plans to improve ur business, u realize u have to be unemployed and completely crazy to get anywhere in this game. Dont get me wrong. I loved it to get my fist t3 washplant ready (Transport, Installation, first cleanout) and went to work, but to get there i didnt even play the game properly. after t1 i thought i have to search for the good spots and rented a drilling machine. With that thing, i got nealy all my gold by drilling my parcel with the rented machine on timescale 1x. (u get up to 500g gold nugget from drilling....) All in all i got about 50.000 gramm gold. Thats more that a million $ and it take much less time than digging.

Real play without nuggets its the f..... maximum of a hell of a grindfest. I mean that. It cant get any worse. The only thing u have to do is digging with the excavator and getting more money to get better parts.

On top:
- u are completley alone. There is no npc or any other life that some soundy birds.
- noone can help u. No mp, no npc, no worker or anything. U have to do ALL by urself.
- there is no real story
- the blacksmith is a scamming f...tard.
- the bank is a scam too....
- ur workers are lazy perk jerks and the lvl up is ridiciously slow.
- i got a 2070s and a 3700x and the game has unacceptable fps drops
- there is a bug that the FE-Loader deletes the gold from the dirt when u are excavation from the bedrock. wtf? Devs that cant be it right?

Do urself a favor and invest ur money in a game which is not as grindy as this game unless u have too much time and a veeeeeeeeeeeeeery long breath.

Conclusion:
Pros: Realistic alaska gold mining.
Cons: everything else.

I figured my request would get denied. $16 is a lot of money. Let's not worry about the fact that I probably should have not given this game a second chance, and filed for a refund just minutes after I installed it. I guess maybe I was hoping that I was just having a rough go with the game, and probably just needed some time before I would learn it, and maybe find it to be enjoyable.

But as you can tell, that didn't happen. With a grand total of 50 minutes, just short of an hour, and even after two tries, I found the game/simulation to be repulsive to the point that I uninstalled it, and will never ever try it again. Sucks to be me huh? I shell out some cash, because it really looked fun on YouTube, but in my hands, it was garbage.

So keep your 16 dollars, and in the future, I'll learn to not give crappy games a second-chance, and immediately request a refund if it's not going well. My loss... and I'll be more prompt with refunds in the future. Maybe I can download a bunch of games, and if I don't like them, or don't have time to really try them out, I'll just refund them... over and over again. I mean, why should I alone be the one that wastes my time and money, when I can affect your customer service reps?

Sixteen dollars... or a hundred and sixteen... a refund is a refund if it's valid for only two weeks. As long as I spend less than an hour on each, I can take you up on your refund system, without any hassles, right?

Enjoy your free money, and an unsatisfied customer. More power to ya.

I am posting this with 129 hours of game time.

I love this game! Its everything I could dream of in a start-from-nothing-become-rich type of game. Your hands on. Your in control of lots of things.

However the game is few years old or so now and even though its great - the game runs pretty rough. It isn't optimized well. I am running Geforce GTX 1660 ti, 16gb memory, Intel i7-9750 and should be able to run this game on ultra. There are TONS of games I can run that came out around that time frame that I can play on ultra. Heck I just beat RE Village on ultra settings with no issues at all...

But this game - constant FPS drops. You can turn on FPS counter and its never steady - its always bouncing all over the place. There are times I will go into the town the the FPS will drop to like 5 while LOOKING at the town. If I turn away - all is good. Turn back - FPS drops... 

The game is not optimized. And from what I hear across the forums the Devs don't seem to want to fix this. Its like they gave up fixing something that breaks players from wanting to play their game.

I have even tried all the graphic settings - constantly bouncing around. And like I said, people say Devs don't care and are only focused on seasonal leaderboards now.

Also - they are likely focused on on the CONSOLE release. I sure hope the console version runs better or goodbye good reviews. And I am sure the console release for players who have not been on PC get this and are fans of the show and see all the old machines and not what we are seeing today - that will hurt their ratings as well.

Now on a different note. I love the shows Gold Rush and Dave Turins Lost Gold Mine.... Dave was in Gold rush for awhile.

Anyways... The game came out and by the looks of it the game only has like seasons 1-4ish of content. And I just started playing - I would expect updates to the game introducing new equipment we are seeing in the show.

There is no workshop - modding abilities. I am not sure why... I think that would help greatly add stuff from the shows.

If Devs want people to have faith in their game - you don't abandon the discord. You don't ignore suggestions even though I am told they are relayed to you by the community mods. Devs should be more active in their discord. I am 100% Positive the Suggestions box === recycle bin.

The next game they are making looks... I am sorry to say it bluntly... dumb... stupid... boring... But I am sure it'll attract some kind of crowd.

I am also one of the few players who is happy its singleplayer.


In general... its a great game, I really like it. But in terms of how it runs and the content = that hurts the game. I was told the Devs used to be on the Discord for talks and now they are gone and only the community mods relay information back. That to me tells me they REALLY do not care. I think the Devs should seriously make a sequel to this game with an updated game engine, updated machines, and better optimization. This game is likely one of their best sellers. Also the devs need to return to their community. This is such a great game and it sucks its basically dead in the water.

So here goes my review of this game. I personally love the game for many reasons that I will get to but I also have some cons for this game. First off with the game are the pros. I love how many machines there are and that you can set up different types of wash plants like de-rockers and trommels. The multiple claims are cool and the different challenges to get to then. The digging and vehicle mechanics are pretty cool and the game is a great time waster. They recently added to the workshop and its cool to finally have some of the things we have in there now.  Now onto some of the cons I have found with the game. The biggest one is that there is no multiplayer in this game and the devs don't seem to have any of that planned so if you want a mining game to play with friends, this is not the game for it. Another issue is you need an ok computer to run this game. Another issue is when travelling around the map, you hit certain parts of the map where it loads the new section in and even with an ok computer it still takes some time to do and if you have a bad computer, the load will freeze you and sometimes if you are transporting things in the back of your truck, it will go every wheres and is a pain to clean up. Even though this game has some cons, I would recommend it for people who like the TV show gold rush, want to experience something close to mining or want a interesting time waster

I had heard that this game was a cheap version of a bad TV show called Gold Rush,

therefore my expectations were LOW for this game.

Booted the game up for the first time, and had MASSIVE frame drops, Bad sign.

Changed the quality settings, and was pleasantly surprised by how big the map is, most of which the player can't really interact with, but looks decent and adds a bit of world building.

I decided to skip the tutorial thinking this would be an easy 'go here, do X, go here, sell X'  type of game.

I was extremely wrong. I hadn't bought any equipment or a lot at all. I then opened the journal and found out that there is not only a tutorial I skipped, but a helpful guidebook BUILT INTO THE GAME FOR DUMBASSES LIKE ME.

I found out how to RENT a lot and what to start out with.
Traveled to the lot, and then found out I had to ASSEMBLE my equipment, which actually was simple to do, 
Then I started to dig up dirt, plop it in the sorter, and wash out the dirt to sort it, basic gold prospector stuff (that I have no experience in, so I will not be commentating how "true" it is to real life.) I then had to pan out dirt chunks to find the actual gold bits I started this entire thing for, which after a bit of fucking up controls, quickly got the hang of it and, again, it's actually pretty fun to do. I then came out with 8 whole grams of gold, which I had no idea what to do next, so I referred back to the journal which told me to go to the blacksmith and smelt my gold so I could then sell it to the bank.
Thought it was a pointless trip, so I went, smelted it and.....wait a minute, it takes actual time (ingame, therefore is under the same 12x time multiplier as the player, thanks devs.) I had a 30 minute timer, which would be converted to 2 minutes of actual time, where I could go fuck around town finding collectibles. Came back, got the bar, chucked it in my truck, then went to the bank to sell it with no problem, and I note that the price of gold changes per day, giving the player another mechanic to work with, I love it. I then bought upgrades, figured out how to set up a water pump, and I am currently on working towards making more profit to automate digging a little more.

I have only played this game for 3 hours, and I already recommend it if you're into tycoon games.
There is a real sense of starting out from near nothing and working your way up the ladder, which is real satisfying, and not something that many games struggle to do.

Rating
Story-N/A (Sandbox-mainly, side stories about locations that serve for collectibles to discount prices)
Setting-9/10
Gameplay-10/10 

Overall-9/10

Personal note- This game really surprised me with quality. Took a look at the show, and I actually prefer the game.

The game is very repetitive. You will shovel a lot of dirt. The fun starts once you get your first excavator(I'm not there yet, but I played with it in the tutorial).
As I understand, this game is based on some TV show, which must have been a total economic failure, because the budget for this game is clearly way below average.

However, the gameplay is fun and addictive. I just wish they would make it look nicer and sound better.
The town this is taking place in, is like a ghost town from a horror game or film. The streets are empty, just a few rotten cars, at least the church bell and the gas station still work.

I really like how they did all the cable and hose management. There are a bunch of different generators, water pumps and all that stuff a real gold digger would want.

As of now, get it when it's on sale. If they rework graphics and some sound effects, I would even recommend it for full price. It's good.
Drifting in the pickup is also a lot of fun. ;)

--Update after reaching 40h--

I can say I had a lot of fun in the game. The beggining was awesome, reaching tier 2 too and reaching tier 3 was fun but also hard. The amount of work you have to do is incredible. Just installing tier 3 took me 3 days in game. But, the hardest thing, is taking all the dirt with the excavator, the dump truck and repeating all the process one time, another, and another, and another...forever, because you have no employee that work with you. I mean, image Gold Rush Parker running all the thing alone...its impossible (well maybe for parker is possible XD), you have to be the operator, engineer, manager, laborer of all possible types...all the work is up to you so...it has not any sense. While is fun you can check all that by yourself, you should be able to have employee to do the most tedious work (like taking and moving arena, at least).  

So where the game fails is this, there is no progression in terms of your responsibility / title. You can't get promoted even though you are the boss, because you are also the only worker XDDD So since things don't happen alone, you can't alternate between working (as an operator ...) and doing other tasks that require less effort and time invested.

Otherwise, the game is great and has a lot of potential, but it seems that it is no longer receiving updates. It seems that with the launch of consoles the game could revive, I will put attention in the future, since for now I leave it here, I can not invest so many hours of my life in taking dirt and taking it to another site XDDD lol

The only "updates" you get are minor bug fixes. And even with as many hot-fixes that they've released, the game is still incredibly buggy! I've been waiting for so long for an update to bring me back. But its never came. All the dev's seem to care about anymore is the flipping leaderboards. And the only thing that you get from them is a skin. Btw there are much better looking skins in the workshop. TL:DR Don't buy the game. It never gets or will get another update with content. Just wait till Gold Hunters come out. Otherwise your just burning your money.

This game Had so much potential when it was first released. Only huge issue is, the the developers don't listen to the community. I.e fixing certain bugs which I see on there discord all the time, adding newer modelled machines along side the old ones to liven the game up and make it more thrilling and enjoyable to play to have something to work towards getting.

To sum up my rant and rave, i wouldn't bother with this game at this time. I'd either wait till there's more of these types of games on the market or have a look around at other games coming up.

There are several aspects I would like to discuss about this game. First off, the content of the game. It starts out slow and you gotta really grind to get to the large equipment. It's reasonable, and even if you have all the money needed to get all the equipment to the site, it can take a while to set everything up with all the large equipment. I do like how it's not just a "purchase and it shows up at the dig-site" as this adds more content to the game that is not all that much artificial. Overall, I enjoy the amount of content in the game.

Next aspect I would like to discuss is the automation. The way the game is, it really should not be a single-player only game. With the large equipment (not DLC) it is nearly impossible for you to not waste fuel, as it processes the dirt too quickly for you to have a constant flow of paydirt. All the tasks that have to be done are too much for a single person to do efficiently. I would love to give the game a positive review if there was multiplayer, and would recommend it to friends, but that is not something I will do due to the current lack of multiplayer in the game.

Finally, I would like to talk about the liveliness of the background, as in the towns having people and the dig-sites having AI doing even non-progressive tasks. All of these are non-existent. Not a single other person to be seen. If there were even AI to help with the digging, such as assigning them to work in specific areas of the dig site doing certain tasks, that would really make the game wonderful. Unfortunately, the game gives off the vibe of a ghost town and you have nobody helping you at all with the digging, or any aspect of it. 

All these aspects being said, it is a game I would not recommend of you like automation and enjoy things working efficiently. If these things were to change, I would definitely re-evaluate this game, and likely recommend it if the game is positively changed and improved.

BUY IT NOW. This is the most immersive and educational mining simulator I've ever played - it is my new 2nd job and I love it <3

- Graphics are pretty good especially at night!
- You go shopping for parts and can get a loan from the bank!
- You can refuel your truck and water pumps!
- Hooking machinery to your truck is manual labour and needs you to leave your truck - don't forget parking brake!
- The music is relaxing yet immersive!
- so much more!

Development looks very sluggish almost as if one guy is doing all of the work (honestly if you are good for you) It surprises me that a game that offers the player to do soo much just from setting up a water pump, lacks actual content from dlc or other platform support. I've logged over 100 hours across two profiles (yes I bought the game twice just to help the developers and support the game) and it amazed me all we've really gotten are minor bug fixes and paints/skins for vehicles. Physics could be a lot better for ground disturbance, ie; digging and dozing. All and all I say 2/5 stars. First 12-48 hours of gameplay are addicting then once you get to machines it's all downhill from there which blows.

Do as you wish however. It is a fun game for what it is and isn't

Love the open world concept but the game could expand on this even more. Love having all the stuff to buy and use, hoses, power cords, pumps, lights, etc. but GOOD GOD THOSE PRICES! Dissapointed almost none of it looks like things you'd use on a real claim too. Im a professional miner and I dont recognise most of the stuff in game or its just off and weird like the small powered pumps, whats with the batteries on top if it has to be plugged in? Also panning in this game is totally laughable, whoever came up with that needs to go panning for reals and learn a few things. Also the CGI for water and flowing gravel is just weird to look at and who designed the placement of the derocker and other pieces of equipment, the ramps to dump waste have a foot space between them. in the real world that would mean waste rock mixing with paydirt, that stuff just bugs me. Also really wonder why they have not fixed the bug were items you interact with could randomly fly off into space and be lost forever like your buckets full of gold, crates full of buckets of gold.... the hood of your truck lol. Also the simulated water pressure feature will have you frusturated for hours! Just turn it off in options, I personally think its not working right.
All in all I still love this game even though it is poor excuse for a simulator they got the vehicle dynamics down. Definately like to see a version 2 of this game with multiplayer and actually seeing hired personel actually working lol. Maybe a 3rd person view and able to design your avatar. As well update that god awfull panning in a tub thing, let us pan at the rivers edge, expand the world so you can really explore and prospect creeks and rivers. etc. Oh and be able to buy upgraded truck, not just a paintjob, things a turd and when you have 5 mill in the bank you should be able to buy a new chevy/dodge or something.

I've never been into the gold mining scene, never even looked into it.  Several years back, I somehow found the RCSparks "Youtube Gold" series and fell in love.  I am so happy to have this game and be able to replicate the things they were doing.  If you go into this game blind, you're going to have problems.  You really need to follow the tutorial and/or watch gameplay from other people.

Once you get the hang of it, this is such a fantastic game! It's very laid back and allows you to relax and do mindless tasks that, at first you have to think about to memorize, but after several times of doing it, it's like breathing.  You know how and don't have to think.

My only real complaints are that 1) There are limits as to how many vehicles you can have out at once on each claim.  
2) Vehicle selection is pretty small right now.  I'd love to see a skidsteer, small excavator and a smaller dump truck.

Other than that, I am very happy with GR. It lets me sit back, listen to music and mindlessly dig.

Perhaps most of the bugs have been addressed, or I am lucky, but I have not encountered any of the bugs mentioned so far after a couple of  weeks of exellent game play. I started watching the show to learn about gold mining but could not get past a few episodes due to the focus on drama and non gold mining related nonsense. This game really scratches that itch. You will learn the basics of gold mining and have fun while doing it. This game is exactly what I was looking for and I would recommend it to anyone that is interested in a gold mining sim. A general question posted in the general discussion.  Simple question   " can you have more than one saved game? EDITING AGAIN! 
Turn off CPU Culling in the options and you'll experience a much better FPS. That's all. No one told me this and I was tired of trying to play so after a little messing around, I figured out this was the problem.

MY REVIEW AFTER MOST RECENT UPDATE:
After the most recent update the FPS lost is substantial. Before I could play with almost zero FPS drops unless it was quicksaving. I lowered my settings and nothing helped. Went from having 40-60 FPS to 15-25. I can play, but I have to look at the ground or deal with the game constantly lagging. I think I'm going to officially retire this from my library and uninstall. It was a great game to pass time. I was starting to go for all the achievements. 

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
After 150 hours, I must leave a review. This game is fun, until you get to your last washplant tier. Then it gets tedious, tiresome, and honestly downright boring. This game needs a few things, #1 multiplayer/co-op gameplay. #2 Mod support.
If the developers are going to let this game die, they should at least let the fans mod it and allow custom items. 

I enjoy the crap out of this game, it's a easy way to relax, and I'll leave a thumbs up for it. 
Developers, get your stuff together. Either make a sequel or at least let people mod this game.

I really really enjoy this game. The only downfall is that I don't think I've ever seen a game so poorly optimized. My PC stands head and shoulders above the recommended specs and when I drive to the shop from my land or have a few big of machines running or if it's snowing while I'm digging, it's unplayable. No crashes yet but things like 5 to 10 fps just when walking around the shop sometimes. This game should easily be at 30-60 fps at all times, it's 1/10th the size of games like GTA, SCUM, ARMA 3, Red Dead, The Forest, Subnautica, and other huge survival games. Those games run consistently at 60+fps. Mist Survival is a decent size game that gets 30-60 frames and that's just ONE DEV that made it on his free time. I'd dare to say even DAYZ runs better than this game. That's not a good place to be. BUT I still recommend this game, I play it almost every time I sit down. It does get a little repetitive when you have to grind for a bit to earn money but it's pretty cool how you have to learn to use each machine and monitor repairs, that keeps it fresh even though you kind of are doing the same thing over and over again. The attention to detail in things like repairs and moving equipment around is unique compared to other games too. It's definitely worth playing but get it on sale.

I like this game only because I don't mind that it is nothing like the show. The show has alot more then one person running all the equipment and has people to make it look good. These Dev's are a joke. They don't care what the public want, and they don't work on bugs before releasing a expansion. The game has bugs that were there from day one and they won't work on those, instead they would rather just slap a new coat of paint on it and keep going. extremely dissapointed with the development crew on this game.

I was coming into this game expecting it to be grindy, based off of the other reviews.

Grindy can be ok, as long as the actual gameplay is fun, rewarding, engaging, etc. Controlling any of the machines in this game however, is neither of these things and the amount of time you would need to invest to get anywhere in the game without the nuggets function easily runs into double digit real life hours. Nuggets is basically just the game giving you about 5-10x as much gold as you would get from actually using the gold sieving machines for free at random points while you are digging up the terrain.

I can't even fathom how some people play this without the nuggets turned on, digging in the sand with a shovel for 4-5 hours (real hours, not in-game) just to get enough money to buy the first tier of automation.

I play a lot of games that are or can be grindy and are based in simulation. FS19 or recently Fishing North Atlantic, for instance. But there the grind is actually fun. Machines operate well and the gameplay loop is engaging and entertaining. This is just a poorly made, poorly optimized and poorly supported game, which is a shame, giving how much fun it could have been with just a little bit more thought and love put into the game design.

I really can't recommend this to anyone but the most hardcore, masochistic and bored gamers out there.

This was kind of hard for me since the game is fun and I had zero performance issues.  But the grind grind grind is absolutely soul crushing.  I've spent 17 hours either hand shoveling dirt into a box or using an excavator to move dirt into a wash plant.  The worst part about all of it is every time you deposit a load of dirt, you barely fill anything up.  The efficiency is awful.  When you move from hand shoveling to the excavator you start to move exponentially more dirt, yet your gold pay out is only a little bit more.  The prices of machinery are obnoxiously expensive and when you calculate out how much gold you need to sell in order to upgrade your operation, well, I just closed the game instead as I don't have the time nor the desire to grind that long.

You can turn everything to be just $1, but that kills all sense of progression and isn't a mode I'm interested in.

It's fun setting up your operation, buying stuff from the store and figuring out how to hook everything up.

The first time I tried this game, I thought it was terrible. Unfortunately, that was because the tutorial just throws you into a Tier 3 setup and tries to explain it all to you and how to run it. It's a bad design choice. If you skip the tutorial and go straight to mining your own plot, the game is fantastic. Just read the journal and go about it that way. There's only a few downsides to the game after having played it for 24 more hours. The machines are drastically under-powered. You have tracked bulldozers and excavators that can't make it up a tiny hill of dirt. It's ridiculous. The lack of multiplayer in a game with this much work is also a serious black eye. 

Other than that the game is tremendous fun. There's lots to do and you're always looking to upgrade and progress. I highly recommend it.

Game itself...Great...Mining

Developers - Please understand that making something hard for the sake of being hard is not fun...yes I am speaking about driving.

So I need to go to town...it should not take 1 hour to get off my mine site. This is not challenging or fun...its punishment for your lack of creative ability.

For starters my game saves or loads every 10 seconds...causing control of game to lag. My computer is not new and internet is not fast. But the driving controls in 4wd or 2wd are sloppy. You made it this way to make driving harder to simulate 4wd off-roading. FAIL.

I turn and game loads, saves or overreacts and I go from tree to rock to post etc. I quit my game not because concept is not fun, or mechanics of mining is not fun. Its fun and interesting. Its just the driving.

So for free here are some ways to improve the game. Driving should be hard but its not a driving game off mining site. Try flat roads with mud that slows you down. longer route if you must punish your players. But making it near impossible to drive is game breaking.

Final thought, how about making fast travel a hardness option....oh wait you made it cost money...so we have to grind like heck to avoid your poor design. i honestly don't understand the reasons your keep this design when the rest of the game is great.

Did you put your brother in law in charge of the roads? Buy this game for the mining leave the game due to BS roads and steering!

I rarely (if at all) take the time to review games, simply because most of the time what I enjoy is deeply personal and doesn't always translate to others. 

I have nearly 60 hours in the game and I absolutely love it. No, the graphics aren't amazing. Yes there are weird bugs, but most are comical (I still have a Sluice Box stuck in the lower atmosphere for some reason, just hanging out like a strange celestial friend). 

The game play is immersive; there is no sitting around and waiting. There is just the right amount of resource planning, grinding, and routine. If you like simulation games, I urge you to give this one a try. Do not expect a perfect game, but it is still a blast nevertheless. 

One recommendation for those having graphical lag; ditch the shadows in the video settings. You wont notice a difference, and your frame rate will dramatically improve!

This game and I have a bit of a love-hate relationship... It has some glaring flaws, but it's also relaxing and and fun.

Cons:
-The vehicles do not always act in a realistic way. Your bucket on the excavator might get stuck in the dirt, or on a wire, or another vehicle and it takes a minute of fiddling to get it out. Your front end loader might get stuck and not be able to drive over a tiny little bump or dip in the terrain. etc. 
-Physics can be really glitchy. You can pick up a crate full of miner's mosses and have them shoot up into orbit for no reason. I have also had my front end loader glitch out and fly across the map, smashing into my truck and mobile fuel tank and shunting them both into the hillside under the terrain. They were fine after resetting them, but the physics can get pretty noodley to say the least. 
-Framerate is a mess. I'm convinced that even if you had a NASA supercomputer you would still get dropped frames, stuttering, and freezes entering/exiting menus.
-Even on max settings the graphics leave a lot to be desired. The individual textures look ok, but seeing them on objects in the game world is rough. Jaggies everywhere even with max AA, weird lighting issues, dirt textures disappear, lot's of obvious pop-in, and optimization issues.
-The controls feel quite floaty, yet somehow are just precise enough to get the job done. When you pick something up some objects allow you to rotate them for easy placement in a specific orientation while others do not. So placing a spotlight in a specific place at the correct angle can end in a 5 minute battle of frustration as you repeatedly pick up the light, drop it, watch it fall over, then rinse and repeat until you get the pixel perfect angle for it not to fall over after you drop it.
-Feels like you are almost constantly refueling everything all the time. Jump in the loader, spend 10 min digging and you are out of fuel. If it wasn't for the onsite big fuel tank it would be unplayable. Also fuel is like $11.57 a gallon so prepare to spend a lot of your hard earned money on gas. 
-Worker spawn rate needs to be drastically increased. As it is, a new worker might show up once every 3-4 in-game days, which is not cool when their main skill is random and you need one for every vehicle, every piece of the washplant, plus an overseer and mechanic. Workers also need to progress in experience to unlock the more useful perks, and are SLOW to level up as they only gain experience when the washplant is processing paydirt. In my game I had 17 workers and was dishing out about $10,000 a day in worker wages. 


Pros:
-The game is relaxing and fun to play. Pretty straight forward... Dig dirt, put it in the washplant, clean out the washplant, repeat. 
-Gives a feeling of accomplishment as you progress through a claim and can see how much paydirt you processed.
-No real "end-game." All the upgrades just let you process more dirt, make processing more efficient, and make the processing faster. At the beginning and "end" you are still just dumping dirt into a machine to watch gold come out the other side, the difference is what machine you are putting it in and in what quantity. 
-Tutorials are there and for the most part are pretty good.
-Devs can be a bit derpy, but they update the game regularly, patch bugs, (mostly) listen to the players and adjust things accordingly. Early in the games life there were two groups of players, one group wanted a hyper-realistic mining simulator, and the other wanted a more casual fun experience where they could swim through all the gold they mined like Scrooge McDuck. This forced the devs to kinda walk a middle ground before ultimately siding more towards the simulator player base. Several systems got reworked, for example instead of workers passively mining a small amount of gold ever couple mins, they now work as a perk system that increases the efficiency of your washplant and do useful things like swap out buckets and miner's mosses when full. 

Conclusion:
The game is worth getting if you can deal with it's faults. As I said it's fun and relaxing. The kind of game you can play while watching a movie or show and just want to unwind a bit. Be prepared for weird physics stuff to happen every once in a while and save often.
