Update 22/10/2017:
Some improvements in the last few days. The game is now playable, still wouldnt recommend it yet though because there are alot of bugs and its obviously a work in progress.

Update 13/09/2020:
So I decided to give this another shot. Still pretty terrible. Extremely slow to make any kind of money. You need to spend hours upon hours shoveling dirt into the hog pan at the beginning. Yes there is a "creative" type mode but for people who dont want to "cheat" or would like to play a career, be prepared for many hours of shoveling.

Initial Review:
Completely unplayable, feel really suckered into buying this. 
First play - crashed just after loading. 
Second play, player got stuck in a 1 foot hole I just dug with a shovel. No way to recover. 30 mins play time wasted.
Third try, frame rate dropped while driving (it pauses to load the next section of map every couple of minutes) when the frame rate came back I lost control of the truck and crashed. And so did the game. 

This game would be getting critisism as an early access title let alone a game that is supposed to be at version 1.05.

Wouldnt recommend buying until the devs get their act together. If it was released as early access I would have more sympathy.

This will be my private opinion.

This game is a major letdown. It has really good potential, but fails miserably.

1) No Metal detector gameplay. It would be a natural thing to do in this game. In RL even the big machinery operators use it regularly. It would be a logical 1st step to collect your first small pile of gold which you could then invest into heavy machinery.


2) No random. After only a few minutes of playing, the player knows that one shovel of dirt equals 4 x 1% of Mat filling (Tier I mining). So to fill up the Mats, you need exactly 100 shovels of dirt. Then you get the gold from the mats, which will be 5 grams / mat. Maybe a little more, but never under 5 g.

This basically kills the whole purpose of the game. You always exactly know how much gold will you find. You lose the excitement of happening upon a richer patch, or getting annoyed by a poor result. No, you always get (I wanted to say find, but that is not a really good word here, right?) the SAME amount.

From here, the "hunt for gold" becomes repetitive labor, since there won't be ANY surprises. And I understand, that in RL, the gold hunting is indeed really hard work and very repetitive. But RL the results always vary. They can and do ALWAYS hope to find the big one, the million dollar nugget. Here? Nope. 5 g / Mat.

For me, the only hope here was the random nuggets, but that was very poorly implemented again. You just get a text message that you got a big one. They are also quite big, the size which the real gold miners rarely find. I'd expected small, few gram ones, and rarely, very rarely something bigger. 

But even these dry up after a while, when the game thinks that now you have enough, so even if you selected the option to find these, you won't find them.


3) No multiplayer. And not even hope for MP, as the devs stated, they would need to rewrite half the game. Seriously, they must have considered that this game would naturally require Co-op MP. Almost every RL gold miner work in teams, especially those who use heavy machinery. So they had to know from day 1 of Initial design, that MP is a very important part for a game like this. 

So I smell something here, because I'm sure that devs wanted MP, but they were not allowed to do it. It is not even hard to do it in Unity engine.


4) No gold weighting. It is just a small issue beside the other ones, but then again, that is the most important part in the gold miner TV shows: learn how much we found. Of course, here we know beforehand, so it wouldn't be as exciting.


5) Fixed placement. You don't plan, carefully consider which equipment should go where, what would be the perfect spot. You just fill up the prescribed spots. You can't move your gear somewhere else, which would suit you better.

6) To say something good too, I liked the music, never got bored of it.


All in all, it is a huge disappointment. It has huge potential, but widely misses the most important marks. I don't recommend it to anyone.

I was skeptical at first because of the many negative reviews and bug complaints but I went ahead and bought it to try for 2 hours anyway.  Perhaps most of the bugs have been addressed, or I am lucky, but I have not encountered any of the bugs mentioned so far after a couple days of game play.  I started watching the show to lean about gold mining but could not get past a few episodes due to the focus on drama and non gold mining related nonsense.  This game really scratches that itch.  You will learn the basics of gold mining and have fun while doing it.  This game is exactly what I was looking for and I would recommend it to anyone that is interested in a gold mining sim.  My one criticism would be the somewhat odd textures for the terrain.  I am pretty sure it is not my system since I hear others commenting on this.  The textures for the man made objects are great however.  As with any game, I recommend watching some youtube video's to see if the game is for you.  I recommend DieselDesigns Gaming, I thoroughly enjoyed his LP's and still watch them for tips.

I've logged my fair share of hours in this game so i feel like its time for a review. I purchased this game a few years ago when it was first in early access. I have got my moneys worth from this game. it has came a long way but there are still many things lacking in the way of bugs ect. that i cannot ignore. The bulldozer is absolutely worthless, I repair heavy equipment for a living and i have logged my fair share of time in the seat of equipment over the years. tracked equipment should not get stuck on small ant hills. this game needs multiplayer something terrible as the grind is real. it seems that the devs have pretty much gotten their money out of it and the content coming out holds little value as far as game play improvements go. yes i would recommend this game as i have enjoyed it. its quite the grind. the gap between the mobile plant which is barely better than using the hog pan takes a large amount of time. the gap between the stationary wash plant tiers took me less time than it did to get from the mobile plant to the stationary plant. If you like grindy simulation games and can put up with the bugs you'll enjoy it.

Now you may be wondering why I am saying don't get this. This game at first was pretty fun. I would go as far to say enjoyable. But...that was back when I had hope for the game. It has been well over a year and very few issues have been fixed. Basically to sum up what I would say about it into a short story is this, they put a band-aid on a severed limb call it good. They absolutely REFUSE to change anything major about the game (even if it is stuff for QOL and to make it better in general) and you wanna know the response they had when people asked them about big changes or ideas? "It's to much work." i mean just simply adding an NPC in the game is to much of a burden for this team and probably won't ever have any. My opinion is, wait for Gold Hunter, that game (I'm calling it now, will KILL THIS GAME FROM LAUNCH!!!) will have many more features, a more competent team, will have CO-OP and more to come. If you can bear having numerous bugs, glitches and just random stuff happen just because, be my guest and I hope you have fun. I am done with this game.

The game is almost exactly the same as it looks, there isn't really any bugs. only issue is machines getting stuck and the physics being a bit off on the models, for example the dozer and diggers are built in the physics engine in such a way so that it essentially has 4 points of contact with the ground like the wheeled vehicles, so as soon as you move the front of the tracks or back over a certain point the machine tilts over and bottoms out between the 2 points, which can be quite annoying. the dozer could do with a ramp setting or something to that effect, ramps are very hard to make. it's fine for the blade width but as soon as you try a 2nd push it is near impossible to get a flat ramp. only other thing would the chunking of dirt, makes it quite annoying when you want to dig at a certain level. 

I would like an option to have the processing plant pieces automatically go to their spots when transported to a plot, they can be a pain to place sometimes.

other than those few small things which you can get used to, the game is quite fun and the competitive seasons make for a nice start every so often.

The game has issues with nvidia RTX cards, found several other people reporting framerate issues after I tried the game and experienced framerate problems on my computer (using nvidia RTX 2060). Could have been an enjoyable game, but became annoying with the framerate drops. Seems the RTX issues have been reported long time ago, and doesn't seem to be a priority to fix.

Also the game stutters when loading while driving the pickup truck, not exactly sure why it needs all the loading it does when driving on the small map. Game was installed on SSD, so would imagine the loading would be even worse on a HDD.

Happy that I got a refund, and can't recommend this game for people that have RTX graphics cards.

So far this game is incredibly addictive. The only major bug I have found is with the blacksmith. To avoid the frame drops and possible client crash, just drop that SSAO to off, lower those shadows, and restart client and you will be just fine. 

My only other real complaint is the handling of the truck.. it's pretty bad.. BUT hit C and go to outside view for truck and it is a LOT easier to drive. 

All in all, I am impressed with the complexity of the game and the immersion is DEEP. A great relaxing way to to spend many hours getting those pickers! Would recommend at suggested retail price and an insta-buy on sale!

First of all: I love machines so I started biased. I played countless hours of farming simulator (focused on custom maps meant for the logging) just to play with cool and big machines. I stumbled on this game and as it was kinda cheap in sale + it has machines I gave it a shot. 

The shot lasted longer than I expected (~ 13 hours so far). The textures give me mixed feelings. Some details like the rust on the vehicles are great but trees and bushes look like crap. And not only that: they have this tendency to bounce in the wind like they are on steroids. 

The physics and game mechanics are horrible. I personally would say the worst in this genre. Not sure where to begin. Things that just launch themselves (if they are big you most of the times can find them although I am still searching for a big crate that launched itself during loading at the store). Small objects (like poles or plants) that are tougher than a bulldozer and will halt your journey without any doubt. Parts and items (like hoses, wires etc) have a weird way of interacting with each other resulting in a uncontrollable pile in the back of your truck when you have been shopping. 

If you ignore the horrible textures, bad physics etc. than the next thing on my list would be the weird vehicle behavior. Somehow they feel like they have no power. I would expect that when I get on board this big bulldozer I would feel like I got all the power. But no, it feels more like you are riding a lawnmower. Like every small pebble could make it bounce up and every root in the ground would be able to stop it. Same with the front-loader and excavator. Some vehicles feel too slow to be realistic etc.

So yeah, got a lot to complain. Too bad as in it's roots it is a fun game with some depths (like breaking parts of machines, the various steps and tools needed to process the gold dirt etc) that have so much potential but than basically this whole vibe is killed by this feeling the world is so limited. No you cannot take a shortcut through those trees, don't touch the scenery with your machines as it will stop them etc. It feels like you are caged in a concrete world with plastic toy machines. 

So in short: Great game in concept, worst freaking physics and game mechanics that make you angry and frustrated. Will probably play it for another couple of hours and than probably never play it again. 

Regarding recommending: Tough one. If you love machines like I do, maybe it is something but be warned: You will be frustrated.

I can't believe this game is 3 years old, and possibly in early access or something before that. I found it by mistake and thought oh this looks exciting, and the beginning everything seems to work ok, and in a few videos I watched the bigger stuff looks fun... I have gotten to the small Excavator and having a lot of fun with it, it does still have some bugs, but works well for the most part. Then I decided I wanted to pick up all the little boogers of dirt on the ground cause the truck would keep getting stuck on them, so I saved and bought the Payloader. What a mistake, that thing gets stuck on everything, slides side ways, has no power, and oh you guess it, doesn't pick up the little piles of dirt everywhere. Even when using it to dig, it wont get that very bottom layer of dirt, and if you do manage to get it, it's takes a while. So then I reloaded and old save cause I couldn't afford to rent the bulldozer and try that. Again, it doesn't push the little piles, it gets stuck, and also slides side ways. Those little piles really drive me crazy and I cant get rid of them. Not sure I will continue playing the game unless they fix the driving and working mechanics on these machines, a tracked machine like a bulldozer not only should be able to drive easily over piles of dirt like that, but should flatten them, instead in some cases, they stop the machine dead in it's tracks...Then in other cases, they go right through the blade like its not even there...Awsome potential in this game, but way to many things that just don't work properly...

I bought the game in a bundle with some other sim games because I figured I'd give it a shot. It took about an hour to start seeing terrible performance issues, FPS dropping to ~5, unplayable gameplay lagging and freezes, but fortunately no crashes yet. When I turned to the discussion forums for a fix, turns out there's an issue with this game and RTX graphics cards. How a three year old game can somehow become virtually unplayable on a three month old card is beyond me, but if you have a computer that was built any time in the last few years, I guess this game isn't for you. Which is a shame because it seems to be the most in-depth sim game in the PlayWay catalog.

2020 Update: So I went back to see if this game had come any further. Its still highly tedious and dull. The game just feels like a job not a game. I really like the concept of this game but its implementation is weak at best. Sound is alright a little glitchy at times. The map has a few buggy areas and overall the finer points of it are dull. The introduction of seasons, to me at least, is pointless. Overall the review stands and this game is officially shelved forever.

This game is right up my alley. I love simulation games and I love heavy equipment. I REALLY wanted to love this game. Unfortunately, even with a decent and up to date PC (RTX 2060, Intel I5-9600KF, Intel 660p 1 TB SSD) this game suffered from truly terrible frame drops. The frame rate was quite good at first (over 100 fps during the tutorial) but after about an hour it started to drop down to around 4-20 fps, no matter what graphics settings I put it on. Unfortunately, I reached the 2 hour mark of death messing with settings before I came back to request a refund. Don't make the same mistake friend.

More than two years after supposed full release. Game is still very unplayable. Bugs everywhere. Cant load truck. Almost everything bounces out or falls through. So I buy big trailer. I had hoped this game would be a relaxing and entertaining game.
I really really wanted to like this game. 
But unfortunately it's a bugridden mess. 
It feels like it doesn't deserve to be out of early access yet. 
It is so broken on so many aspects that it's not worth playing.

Several gamebreaking bugs a few examples here:
The pickup truck throws items out of the bed, or they simply fall through.
Trailers will bug after a bit of time, making them try to roll over on their own.
Items that has been bought randomly disappear, either clipping through the ground and falling through the map, or just going poof in general.
Autosave STILL causes freezing (this was a 2017 issue)
Still crash issues with specific processors and graphics cards (this was a 2017 issue)
Installer is broken if you have the collectors edition and you will have to manually delete corrupted files as you're installing.

Do yourself a favor, stay away from this.
I've seen games in pre-alpha state that is less bugged than this.
It's just downright discusting that the developers take money for something they never fix.
Don't buy this, the game is very poorly optimized and suffers from large frame drops regularly. Unless the game is under $10 it is not worth the cost of purchase.
The idea of the game is fun and it was relaxing, but the amount of bugs and just how broken the game is it's not worth it. Wait for it to be fixed. I have requested for a refund.

I bought this game back in 2017 and it was fun for the most part. There was a few bugs here and there, but I didn't mind it as I could still play the game and enjoy the content. Now the game has so many bugs, the game is basically unplayable. 

First of all you have to shut off the engine in the car and turn on the handbrake, otherwise items will just fall through the bed of the truck (this is not at bad.) The bug that breaks the game is when you take an item out of the truck and try to drive the truck again. The game recognizes the item as still in your truck even though it is out of it. So when you attempt to drive away the items you removed from the truck will start moving and your truck will not be able to drive. The game has a restore option which is supposed to help this issue but the issue persists even with the restore option or reloading the game.

When this game was first fully released on Steam it was in an unacceptable state, and not worth buying.
While it is still very unacceptable that developers fully release games in such a state, they have worked hard over the years to finish the game, and it has come a very long way and is finally in a more complete state with most bugs, features and issues fixed.
It also features quite a lot of new content and it continues to be updated even to this date.
There are some minor issues and poor design choices left still, but those can be mostly ignored now.
This is the most realistic voxel based gold digging experience you will find at present and highly recommended if you like relaxing simulator games with repeating tasks and gameplay.


[u][b]OLD REVIEW:[/b][/u]
[i]*This review was posted when the game was first fully released on Steam.*[/i]
Though this game is kind of fun, it's incomplete and full of bugs, half finished features, unbalanced and very frustrating due to all that. It would of been acceptable had it been an early access title, but this is a full release title and so its absolutely not OK and you should vote with your money by not buying it so these kind of shady releases stop happening.

I would NOT recommend this game at this time. hard FPS drops  at night, and only raises a little by day 2. The zone loading kicks you FPS too make you crash into the fences brake something on your truck. I can see that this game would be a great one in the future. The tutorial is great to get you into the game. It can be relaxing at times.

Good vehicle controls and the game is certainly a simulator.

However there is one point in this game that made me almost instantly uninstall and get bored with the game.

It is the moment you realise that the engineering side of the game, and how you build the wash plants, is completely static, tiered and set out for you.

For example, each claim has a location where you can build certain equipment, you can only place certain parts in certain areas. And although you can buy a mobile wash plant that you can put anywhere, there isnt any real customisation or sandbox features in terms to creating the actual wash plant. And so the only actual creative process in the game comes down to where do you dig (which is also partly layed out for you), and what equipment do you buy (not a huge selection at all)

And so its more of a management game, rather than a mining sandbox game.

This is a "good"  'no' review.

If you like sim games, this certainly gives you a boring job to do, and progression will be kinda slow (very, very slow if you don't choose nuggets!  Please choose 'yes' on nuggets!") 

Unforunately, a lot of the busy work is pretty unrewarding,  Giving you new 'toys' to play with comes very slow, and ineffective as most of your time is spent on just digging up dirt, going though different positions for different machines.. and ulimately just spending thousands of dollars worth of money/gold,  because you processed a little dirt.   

That daily cost is a bit too punishing,  and with nuggets, becomes trival to the point of little effort being put in.  You either have stupid amounts of money. or low amounts of money..

*Despite* that.. I would generally give this a good review! except.

The actual system this game is working on, is terrible..    Graphically, it's nothing impressive, but there are often stutters, frame drops, frame hitches and stalls,  the loading phases for parts of the map are very common and often hold the game when travelling anywhere for 5-10 seconds, with the next loading transition being just feet away from the last one sometimes..


The lighting is nice when it's bright out.. but anytime the sun is out of view, the game is ugly, dark and pretty depressing.


Buyer beware,  really.. but if this game interests you,  it's good for what it is.

--UPDATE-- So, I managed to come back to this after giving it some thought and here is what I found. I ended up trading in my shaker rig for a derocker and the problem seems to be solved for whatever reason. Unfortunately, I ended up in so much debt to get the derocker that it just wasn't sustainable. I was putting out about $150K a day between the loan, claim share of the gold (rent) and my workers. After trying for several game days to keep my head above water I finally said, screw it, this wasn't my fault to begin with so I went back a few saves, sold my shaker for what it would give me, set the game to easy and bought the derocker for $1. Now I will set it back to Normal and see how it goes from here. Still not changing from Not Recoomended yet due to how frustrating this game can be. If they had a "still on the fence" rating I might consider going for that. They should put just a little more work into this and it would be very playable. Or maybe the things that need fixing are just really, really broke and it wouldn't pay for the devs to fix them. Not sure...



Well, after 267 hours of trying to gut out this frustrating mess of a game, I may be throwing in the towel. For as long as this game has been out it should be way more polished than this. I have honestly seen better games in an alpha release. I can work past the performance issues and lack of optimization but the physics and the way things react in this game are horrendous. Constant glitches and no console or way to work past them other than constantly going back several saves and losing multiple days (in game) worth of work is far from enjoyable and this just pretty much breaks it for me. Discovery and Code Horizons should be ashamed of themselves for not doing more justice to what could be a super fun and enjoyable way to pass the time. At first I would have recommended to wait and buy it when it went on sale but now? Nah, having worked my way to Pine Valley just to get a T3 set up with a shaker that only shakes by itself (as soon as you put sluice in the whole thing just stops regardless of what order things go in) leaves me saying "hard pass" on this one.

Fantastic gold simulator.  Note that this is absolutely a simulation game!  A very large portion of your time will be spent running electric cables, hoses, and setting up machines.  Then you will use excavators to dig dirt and wash it for gold.  There are multiple tiers to get more and more of the gold out of the dirt.

I highly suggest you remap the excavator's controls to your 10-key pad.  I typically am moving my excavator left and right using my WASD keys, then controlling the three joints on the arm using up to three keys at once on my 10-key pad.  After a while it start to become like an extension to your hand!

Make sure you'd enjoy an excavator simulator before buying this game.  I love watching a show or listening to a podcast while digging!  It's extremely relaxing and fun to progress through the different levels of mining.

Holy hell this has got to be the most tedious game I've ever played! What amazes me is that someone actually coded for this game at some point and it didn't even occur to them to think...."Gee, You know what? I don't know that this is actually going to be fun." Most of the time you're fiddling with equipment and hooking things up. The tutorial is complete trash and the collision detection is garbage as well. If you like carpal tunnel (controller or kb&m) then this game is for you. If you like games that give you little return on enjoyment on amount of effort involved then this game is for you. This isn't casual or puzzle or adventure. This is just tediousness on steroids. For all you masochists out there....I salute you. This game is simply not pleasurable. Also the game is not optimized at all. You'll be driving down the road and the game freezes for a second and then kicks back in. Not a big deal usually but in this case it throws you headlong into a collision with a wall of rocks. Good luck if you like this sort of game but I don't recommend it. Too bad too. I usually like these types of management games. Oh....and my experience was merely on Easy mode and Tutorial. I never even got into the regular gameplay. No way I'm wasting my life away playing this mess.

This game is fun, the mechanics are simple, and its pretty good value-playtime. I would avoid playing in $1 mode to keep from spoiling upgrades, it kind of ruined the game for me the same way cheatcodes do. I believe the game could use some time-based upgrades that reward longer playtime as extras, such as a used vehicle lot that opens up after you buy your second claim, or even more variants of heavy machinery (even if the difference is in handling or looks alone).

Overall, a thumbs up, if you like strategy based working games, this is pretty good, makes you think while your playing.

I personally love this game.  Honestly it feels about as realistic as a game can get.  However there are some downsides to it and I can see why some of the people trash talking it feel the way they do and I'd like to respond to a couple of the negative reviews I've seen, from the perspective of a player that has spent many, many hours playing it (please note however that I've accidentally left it running on many occasions, so the hours I've actually played are lower than the total hours played by a fair bit).

Is it glitchy?  Yes.  Believe me, I've seen some really weird stuff, like a replacement part not fitting into the spot for a broken part, once I remove said broken part.  I've also seen the mobile wash plant's display disappear many a time, particularly when repairing it, but saving right then and immediately loading that save fixes it.  Annoying, but not game-breaking.

Does it lag?  Yes.  Specifically when driving between a claim and town, there's a spot where it always loads, causing a lag spike for a few seconds, both ways.  It also tends to lag when you save, but neither of these are tremendous lag spikes if you have a decent gaming PC.  If you alt-tab out of it for a while (as in multiple hours) and then come back to it, yeah it tends to lag pretty hard.

Do they add more content?  Yes.  They're constantly adding stuff.  Not just DLC stuff like the Frankenstein either, but non-DLC stuff like the electric water pump and many other pieces of equipment, so stop complaining that they never add anything.

Is the game poorly optimized?  In my opinion no.  Believe me I've seen far worse (Ark: Survival Evolved comes to mind here) and it tends to run fairly well.

Is the game finished?  Not even close from the looks of things.  If you can't stand the "poor optimization" and "lag spikes" and "lack of content" or the game otherwise doesn't live up to your expectations, just wait for the devs to finish working on the game and buy it then.

On a side note (this is for the devs): Someone mentioned they would like to see more claims and I don't really disagree with that, it'd be nice to see new places to mine.  However, one HUGE thing that I saw someone mention and I would LOVE to see is dredging!  Specifically suction dredging, though I think a bucket dredge would be really cool as well.  I know this is supposed to be based on the show Gold Rush and not on the show Bering Sea Gold, but they're nearly the same thing and as an avid scuba diver in real life I would absolutely LEAP at an addition like that, even if it was a DLC.  I would pay FULL PRICE for a DLC that had suction dredging/scuba diving for gold and I NEVER do that, I prefer to always wait for a sale.

Bottom line, I would seriously recommend this game if you're a fan of the show.  One of the few games I've paid full price for (I usually only buy games on Steam if they're on some kind of big sale) because I was just that psyched to play it and didn't want to wait around for a sale.  Absolutely worth every single penny in my opinion.  It ain't perfect, but hey it also ain't finished yet and I'm sure when it is it'll be absolutely phenomenal.

I had my eye on Gold Rush for quite a while, just never bit. I did on the last sale and so far what a treat! I was not expecting to like the game as much as I do! The digging mechanics and ground management in general is fresh from a simulator side and if you like business heavy choices in how you build your empire and manage your dig sites, this game has scratched that itch for me. Throw in the competitive nature of a fresh start leader board run, I'm having a great time!

Cons: 
The physics are a little odd, but predictable. Once you get it, you know what to expect and how to work with it. 
Graphics are not top tier, but that doesn't bother me that much. 

I would love to see another DLC of machines or another map. MP is a MUST in Gold Rush 2 though, huge opportunity! 

It's a no brain decision on sale if you are the farm sim type, and even not on sale, I have most certainly got every penny of my money! Get to running that pay dirt!

So, after 230+ hours in the game i decided it was time to leave a review here. I'll start with a general description of the game, my personal experiences, good and bad things about the game and a short summary.

The game
The game is pretty immersive but still simple. There's 3 different difficulties you can choose; easy, medium and hard. On easy mode you can control every setting in the game and the harder the difficulty you choose, the more restricted, and harder, it becomes. (1$ mode, bear attacks, parts breaking down) You start out as a poor miner with only 500$ to your name from which you can buy a tier 1 plant. The game is build around 5 tiers, with tier 4 and 5 being upgrades of the tier 3 plant. With the tier 1 equipment you can do some small scale gold mining in hogpan area's on each claim (provided you either bought or leased the claim) to earn enough money to buy yourself into a tier 2 washplant. This consists of a mobile washplant and an excavator. Once again you need to earn yourself enough money for the next upgrade, which is the big washplant each claim has located in a different spot but is configured the same. You have a shaker, a trommel, 3 different sluice boxes and 2 jigs. You now need to earn even more money to upgrade each component to the next level. In short, you have equipment with which you earn money to buy better equipment to earn more money to buy even bigger and better equipment.

My experiences
I bought this game not long after it was released. Because it was on sale i decided to buy the Frankenstein DLC with it and to be honest, you really should. The game is very fun to go trough for the first time, but after a while it becomes quite annoying. Why? Very simple, the game is build as a simulation. Because of this you have to do everything yourself, and with that i mean everything. You have to dig the earth, move it to the plant, keep an eye on fuel levels and how much water you use, how full the sluices and jigs are etc. That in my opinion is also the major flaw of the game. You get immersed into an environment where you just need more people. This is why i think you should get the Frankenstein, it takes away one of the chores you have to do. I've got two big saves and a few test saves. One save i started in the hogpan area and worked my way to the top and in the other big save i bought a Frankenstein in 1$ mode and sold it to give me some starting money. Ive had a lot of fun mindlessly digging for gold in between classes at college.

Pro's and con's
As mentioned in my experiences, the major con of the game is having to do everything by yourself. I think this game would've been a great hit if it was developed as a semi multiplayer (4 players max) or if more processes in the game are automated. Yes the worker system where you can hire people to boost the effectivesness of certain parts of your operation helps in some regards, but even that has its limits. Annoyances aside though, this is the best game i've encountered so far that lets you use heavy equipment rather freely. You have a plot of ground you can move on where ever you like with your excavator, you can push earth with your bulldozer in whatever shape you want and the controls for the heavy equipment arent that difficult. 

Summary
I found the game a lot of fun during my first playthrough, theres a lot of different things to try out and understand about the game and if i look back every update implemented into the game were good ones. But in the end i have to give it a thumbs down. Why? Because the game has a real good concept, but after the roadmap was completed (over a year ago) there havent been any major updates, just some little tweaks here and there to fix bugs or introduce new skins. It just becomes mindlessly performing the same actions over and over again while there is so much potential to make it a big game by introducing new machinery, more automated processes so you can become the boss over a mining team (NPC or other players) and other updates.

I hope you had some use of my review. I dont really write reviews often, but i think this game deserved one.

Let me start by saying; I am a real gold miner - I actually work in real gold mines across Alaska, I've personally done almost every job depicted in this game. I really hate the Gold Rush TV show, and I *wanted* to hate this game, but I don't - this is my initial review, I will update this later as I progress through the game.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Decent realism; surprised to see pay layers and drill log information, that's not normally something people know about; also has pumps, generators and larger gen sets, you can even pan for gold and unrealistically get every gold flake with the snuffer bottle on the first try.
- You can hook onto and haul trailers, load up equipment, gas cans, and gear.
- Physics are okay for the most part, they can get a little dicey when you do things like run trailers over though, which you really shouldn't be doing anyways.
- You can completely ignore MSHA and do as you please, this is probably my favorite aspect of the game - goodbye 30 CFR, you won't be missed!
- For a game based on a TV show, effort has certainly been invested, the base mechanics of the game actually work really well.
- Things break; just like IRL things go sideways and can ruin your whole day; unlike IRL however, this rarely results in furiously smashing tools into machines or crawling in the mud under them while cursing your own birth.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Graphics are a little dated, not terribly though, and certainly don't make the game unplayable.
- Machines are weak; I was a little surprised when the excavator wouldn't pick itself up, which is crucial when operating them IRL and vital to moving up and down vertical cut faces, turning, and working on them. Tracked equipment also gets stuck easily, which almost never happens IRL unless you're in seriously nasty deep mud.
- Controls can be a bit to get used to; I run almost every machine in this game IRL (except drills and the Frankenstein), with thousands of hours each (including wash plants) and I had to completely remap the controls to even dig a shallow hole with the excavator. Thankfully that was very easy and only took about 20 seconds.
- Can be hard for lower-end rigs to run, some parts of the town can become extremely laggy, and I have a decent setup. This usually happens suddenly and will often just go away just as suddenly later on.

[b]Things I'd like to see implemented in this game:[/b]
- Northern lights in fall and winter!
- No nighttime in summer, most of Alaska stays mostly daylight throughout summer.
- Tailings and groundwater - the water table in most of Alaska is only a few feet down, cuts constantly fill with water unless your pit management in on-point. Tailings are a constant hassle, I can see why they aren't in game, but I wish they were.
- Cleaner machines - this is a personal pet-peeve, a lot of mine equipment does look identical to this, but I've always taken good care of my equipment (with one single notable exception).

So, sorry for the extremely long review, but I believe if you're going to do something, do it right. Feel free to ask any questions in comments (I will not disclose what mines/companies I work for though). Thank you for reading.

P.S. Everyone saying it's boring and repetitive, [b]welcome to gold mining[/b] - just turn on some music and focus on doing a better job.

Its fun for a while, but gets so tedious that it's hardly enjoyable. If you really like, and I mean to the point that you get off just at the thought of excessive grind and micro, then this game is ok. I keep coming back ever so often to see what has changed and I have to say, over the course of the game it's not much. There are so many glitches and bugs that make somethings just annoying to do and others so hard you might as well not do them at all. It takes so much to get past the early game if you don't play on the easiest difficulty with the gold nugget setting on, which means you get huge nuggets frequently that buffer your cash massively, that the grind is terribly boring.  When you're using the big excavators, expect hideous graphic glitches as well as physical issues that will never be fixed. When you push the bucket down into a hole you're digging, the camera just goes ballistic and destroys the land graphic so you have no clue where your bucket is in reference to the dirt. Not to mention good luck even seeing into the damn hole from any angle that makes it possible to see what you're doing. So the solution is to use the dozer and make paths right? HA... try it. I don't understand the few people that have managed to get that thing to work. The bucket gets stuck on literally EVERYTHING and hardly moves dirt, it actually destroys it last I checked which means you lose money so that's fun. The dump truck is probably the only thing that works correctly and even then, it's buggy as hell and hard to use right. 

To wrap it up, the controls are really not that great. The graphics aren't that great. The game play isn't that great. Have fun running the excavator's bucket... Also enjoy the terrible lag spikes with every auto save and the terrible frame rate for such a low quality graphic game despite the monster of a PC you own. Don't waste your money on the DLC either... that should just be in this lack luster game.

Such a shame that I can't recommend this. 

1) The game crashes on exit. Not a problem, at least it doesn't crash mid game (so far)
2) It doesn't autosave when quitting. Losing 15-30 minutes of effort because you'd think it would have the common sense to autosave or remind you to save is annoying to say the least.
3) Whilst it does a reasonable job of emulating a complex process some things are just annoyingly repetitive and actually unrealistic.. only being able to carry one little plastic bucket at a time, having to spend 5 minutes running back and forth to move 4 buckets across the site is rage inducing.
4) The physics often really suck. Driving vehicles and having them stuck on something only to tear the vehicle apart is also rage inducing. Losing the two front wheels of your pick up or spending 10 minutes stuck on a fence post in an enormous digger with cat tracks is pathetic.

Really wanted to like this but just cannot recommend. Overly complex in too many areas. Lacking polish in a number of areas.

I would also like to add that as nice as it is that they have added new machinery to the game, that comes as paid DLC and not as part of the game. Gee. Thanks.

TL;DR
Very fun and rewarding gameplay, though it suffers from some performance issues. After 9 hours of play i can safely say that I have barely touched the content that this game has to offer. If you like simulation games that require you to do absolutely everything manually then you will most likely love this game, especially for 50% off.

Pros:
-Learn about gold mining (simplified of course)
-Leaderboards add a competitive side of the game
-Satisfying to build up your "business"
-The store is very cool to window shop in before buying items

Cons:
-Even with an average FPS around 120, the frames drop to 50-60 in town
-Game freezes to load when driving between areas, even though it is an open map

Neutral:
-After some research it appears that the Devs have significantly improved performance over time, As long as they continue to do so. then this is worth $20 and more than worth $10 if you can get 50% off like I did.

This game is very underrated and at the price tag it's an absolute steal.  I bought the collectors upgrade purely because I felt guilty for getting such a great game at such a low price.

You'd think a game like this would feel grindy but it doesn't, it's almost relaxing.

100 hours in and no signs of slowing down, loving every minute.  Developers are also very actively improving the game with constant bug fixes and tweaks.

OK so i tried this simulation for about 300 hours. Nothing and i mean absolutely nothing comes as close to actual work than this !! Take gold Mining, a favorite past time of mine, Now shovel endless amounts just to buy the next piece.  

here's what i mean: 

Loadout: large excavator and mobile washplant - takes 12.5 complete hoppers to fill the bucket. large excavator can fill the hopper with 2 dumps. thats 24 dumps into hopper.(if you don't miss) that bucket will net you about 8-10 ounces. lowest piece of equipment around 30k..so thats filling that bucket on washplant at least 4 times. 50 complete hoppers. 100 dumps from excavator.

Large excavator and tier 3 wash plant with dump truck, (about $500k worth of equipment for the complete tier with conveyor)  takes 16.6 dumps from excavator to fill dump truck, dumping that into conveyor and shaker will net you between 12-20 ounces of gold, so 3 dump trucks to buy the same 30k piece of equipment...

not counting the costs of fuel and parcel rent etc etc etc.. oh and fuel OMG! Fuel $10/gallon, haven't seen that in the US since the 1970's!!

Then there's the "PAY DIRT" - I didn't just name it that, the developers did.  google pay dirt, it's something you buy that people are selling to see how many suckers there are out there...it's dirt with an exact amount of gold laced into it that is usually worth about half what you paid for it!

According to the developer in one discussion i read, the dirt is layered in 40 layers about 0.5m each layer and gold is laced throughout, if you dig in the center of that layer then dirt should fall...IE dig at layer 20, 20 layers of dirt should fall from above, Not in this world.... lol!! Only a portion falls but the gold that was in it gets deleted. 

So i tried it, got to tier 3(albeit having to rent some of the pieces instead of buying because too expensive) tried the leaderboard...just sucks the life right out, from all the digging. Too much like actual work..

So to the actual Pro's and Con's:

Pro's
The graphics are ok..about the same as an ARMA game. seems the the terrain is the very same from ARMA3, the vehicles run about like arma...if you hit something the wrong way...it goes flying about the very same way.

Some really thought out machinery, even though it's supposedly about ALASKA, but all the machinery is European except the pickup truck. and it seems straight out of an ARMA game lol.

Con's
Good Concept - bad implementation

Graphics still need work especially in the interactions with stuff (fuel nozzle, small shovel for sluice grates...trailers flying off to no where ville and restored to parcel starting point lol)

Some Dev should count the number of times you have to actually do a thing (example given above, 50 hoppers!!!) to be able to upgrade/go to next stage or whatever, and then adjust accordingly.

Gameplay. - it's just NOT fun. TOO much like (excuse me other retiree's) WORK!!!

Buff's - you can hire workers, but apparently they only give buff's to equipment they are assigned to, and usually cost anywhere from $400 - $3000 per day! Donald Trump doesn't even make that much!!! so yes this goes in Con's, hate games that force you to use buff's to advance. Same as games that promote drug usage "Here eat this painkiller, and you'll be invincible". lol

Ok so the skinny, I bought it and tried it, and now have it in my library for future. it's kind of fun in the very beginning learning new stuff and what to buy, when to buy, that sort of thing (after numerous restarts). Would i play it again, sure after numerous updates maybe. Would i buy it again if i had it do over, absolutely not.

So recommended at first for those that just want something to do, not recommended for long term, it'll suck the life right out of you with digging.

So it's time for my review of Gold Rush the game.
I am going to base my review on the following criteria and score each item of the game out of 100.

1. Game entertainment value.
2. Graphics & realism - The feel and look of the game and how realistic the game is.
3. Functionality of the equipment used in the game.
4. Difficulty level - How easy is the game to use.
5.Pricing of the game - Price of the game and DLC packs.
6. Interactive game play. - How interactive is the game playable with others.
7. Stability of the game. How stable does the game run.
8. Updates and upgrades. How often does the game get updates and upgrades.
9. Creativity interaction -  Players ability to be creative and contribute towards the game and be interaction with the game -  Workshop items.
10 General feedback -  Feed back from both the Dev's and players.

After playing the game since it started back in Oct of 2017 in 2 years of the games release. I have over 1240 hours of playing the game to give a review of how the game has progressed.  

The game has both good and bad  points in each category so I am going to give my review based on the fact that this game is targeting players from all ages young and old. I will give the scores as we review each point.

1. Starting off with the gaming entertainment value , the game has great potential to keep players captivated and entertained, however the lack of progress and development is sadly holding the game back, I will explain in more detail below..  
In the 2 years of the games existence the dev's worked very hard to develop the parts sections and the ability for parts to break down and be replaced by the players, which it adds great value to the game and keeps the players rather busy. So we all grateful for the efforts.

Sadly to report the game has not progressed much further than that given the fact that in the 2 years, we still have the same old slow sluggish front end loader and bulldozer that barely moves dirt around. On the Old Arnolds claim were the terrain is relatively flat the 2 machines just about manage. On the more challenging claims were there are steeper terrain to clime in and out of is where the 2 machines really struggle leaving playing the game rather frustrating. SCORE - 45%

2. The graphics & realism
The graphics of the game is relatively mediocre , whilst the vehicles and equipment gives you the really old equipment feel
the realism is lacking a lot, E.G Using the equipment in the claim there is no dust or dirt on the vehicles being used and the pay dirt is not realistic at all. When digging up the dirt it forms odd clumps or ball shapes that is not the way pay dirt looks in real life.  Other games like Farmsim have better graphics that gives the game and the vehicles a more realistic look and feel.  The graphics for Gold Rush is very out dated and very 1990's type of graphics.
With today's modern PC and gaming platforms and OS systems on the market Gold Rush developers have yet to show us any  improvement  on the graphics to enhance the game to the next level,. As far as realism goes processed pay dirt is far from the reality, there is no overburden to deal with or water ponds in the game, SCORE - 30%

3. Functionality of the game and equipment.
The functionality of the game in general is not bad , keeping in mind that all ages are playing the game so young kids would be able manage to fit parts on the machines. The game does have faults though, as mentioned earlier lack of power on some of the equipment does make the functionality challenging and mostly frustrating. Improvement and more development in this department would make a huge difference in the game. The tipper truck works well and Frankenstein does have glitches sliding around on uneven terrain and slopes when parked.  The game desperately needs improved and newer equipment with more power., players are begging for more. SCORE - 45%

4. Difficulty level
With the Dev's spending a lot of effort in this side of the game giving players a choice of setting the level of difficulty with the toggling on and off of the various scenarios of machines ability to break down and the management of the funds, as well as the leadership board competition side, it has given the players freedom of choice. SCORE - 70%
5.Pricing of the game and DLC. 
Given the fact that the game is out for over 2 years now, I think the pricing of the game is fair, taking into consideration  that the Dev's gave us a free upgrade in the beginning of the game with the drill the DLC of the Frakenstein did spark some outcry from the players, personally I think the DLC was fairly priced and much needed. Are we going to see more DLC in the future is the question now? SCORE - 70%
6. Interactive game play.
Apart from the leader board competition there is sadly no interactive game play between players ( Multiplayer) and the Dev's have made a very stubborn decision that there will not be multiplayer in the future either. This has a big negative impact on the players as many would like to team up and be able to work the claims in various equipment together. Other games have worked in multiplayer into their games with great success. 
Whilst working in the claim and not having the ability to assign a vehicle to a driver be it multiplayer or a driver within the game  and actually see the tipper truck E.G being driven by an assigned player / worker is also disappointing to say the least. The game does have workers in the background doing repairs and various tasks but not actually seeing them conduct the work been done is a letdown. SCORE 0%
7. Stability of the game.
Like any new game in the beginning Gold Rush  was also plagued with many bugs and issues which sparked off outcry from frustrated players.  The Dev's worked hard to try and iron out most of the bugs however there are still a few longstanding bugs within the game. Like buckets sticking to trailers and sluices. Buckets and objects that go flying off trailers being unhitched from the truck. Vehicle sounds not working correctly or not working at all from time to time, 
Driver sticking half outside of the vehicle and parts that gets stuck.  Game stability has improved slightly better, we not seeing as many game crashes to file, The frame rate still needs loads of work done, even with a modern very high powered PC and latest graphics card  the game still shows issues in the frame rate, this could be due to the low end  out dated graphics design of the game. SCORE 50%
8. Updates and up grades.
Dev's have spent a lot of time and effort working on the leader board development and have sent out patches and fixes. Latest word is they are busy working on the controller support for other platforms other than PC. We hope that the Dev's will return to the game and start to improve and address on some of the above mentioned issues and actually paying attention to the needs of the players.
9. Creativity
The ability and need for players, designers and even game developers working together to help improve the game would be so much more beneficial to the game if only the dev's would allow more interactive and creative ideas come to fruition. 
Unfortunately this game is very guarded by the dev's and they are very reluctant to share any  development tools out and allow others to work on projects like in steam workshop. Games like Planet coaster and Zoo, Xplane 11, Flightsim X just to mention a few have all successfully introduced the ability for player interaction and contributions, boosting their games to the next level.  SCORE 10%
10. General feed back
Looking at the community board and discussions between Dev's and players speaks volumes, One can only say that the dialog between player and Dev's would help game improvement if only the Dev's would give more frequent feedback and be more receiptable to ideas and suggestions from players and attend to what the players would like to see within the game. SCORE 30%  This is my view of the game, you decide.

SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!! 

TL;DR:  Don't waste your money, get another game! :-)

Firstly, the controls at start up are ridiculous, I use a controller and when I push my left stick 'forward' (usually for down) the implement your using goes the opposite, up.  This is for all directions and implements.  Yes you can change the settings, by why should you, this should be set up 'out of the box'.

Next, when interacting with something, you either have to align your crosshair EXACTLY (within millimetres) to use/interact with the item (or lower your DPI/sensitivity) and if that doesn't work, you have to try and align the 'outline' with whatever implement currently equipped, once again, you have to be within a poofteenth of a millimetre to make it work and have to be standing at the 'correct' side or otherwise you'll just be 'waving' the bucket/shovel/tool/implement around in the air.

Auto-save.  Go make a coffee and come back, it dumps your FPS and at times freezes all movement whilst it's doing it's thing.  

And talking of FPS dumps/freezes, everytime you move at a 'fast' pace, when you enter the next 'cell' it lags/freezes as it loads the environment.  Don't get me wrong, the scenery and the detail put into it is excellent, however, it's all at the cost of FPS rate and otherwise playability.  The 'devs' (and I use that term loosely) spent more time on the scenery than coding the working and implementation of controls and it shows.

NO MODS!  Why you ask?  After having read the reviews (too late (yes I'm an idiot), I bought the game because I like the show on TV) it seems to me that the 'devs' (again this term is loosely used) are either too frightened or too ashamed to let modders (and others) see the crappy code work that has gone into this 'game' and don't want to be 'shown up' by 'amateurs' (I extensively use mods and as far as I can see/tell, most modders are way beyond being amateurs) and have it 'released/revealed' that the overall coding is crapola and seems to have been 'smashed' together by 'amateurs'.....

So, once again, in a nutshell, go elsewhere with your money, here it's only wasted.

Cheers

Well, decided to try this without using a controller and it's marginally better, completely useless when trying to drive a vehicle as you have no throttle control.  Also when driving, automatically shifts into reverse when applying brake and you come to a stop (on a dime I must say) and starts 'zooming' in reverse straightaway.  Easy fix would be you need to 'release' button/stick and reapply in the direction you wish to go.

One thing that I am starting to hate is that when you pick something up and need to go across your claim with it, it is placed about 6 inches from in front of your face, making you completely 'blind' as you can NOT SEE WHERE YOU ARE GOING!!!!  When you pick up an object, why not have it 40% lower so that you can see the top of it and it would not completely obstruct your vision, but let me guess, this is also too hard to 'change the code' (in normal speak "we have no idea what we're really doing").

So, again, don't waste your money, spend it elsewhere where the dev team actually has clue about their own coding.

Cheers

This is more of a sideways thumb because the tedious game style really isn't for me. It seemed like there was a lot of potential to be fun, but I found the controls for digging to be really janky and I couldn't get very far. On top of that, no matter what I did, the dirt would not land in the back of the truck. Even with the helpful glowing yellow reticle on the ground to guide you, all the dirt still made a pile *underneath* the truck. Jesus Tapdancing Christ.

So only after about 15-20 minutes of 'gameplay' I was completely exasperated and threw in the towel. I won't be asking for a refund because the game wasn't that bad and I hope that the small amount of money I spent go toward game improvements. 

If you enjoy grindy, meticulous games: you may enjoy this. It doesn't seem like a bad game, it just takes a lot of brain space to stay on top of everything and that is not something that is relaxing or fun for me. 

If you don't like grindy, meticulous games: save your money.

I would recommend this game to anyone that likes farming simulator style games. I have 400 hours played in between 17 and 19 and was looking for something to fill that void. This game fit perfectly. The process of slowly building your claim up from hand digging to large machinery is very rewarding and then improving your wash plant and eventually buying more claims to work on. That rewarding feeling is what keeps bringing me back. Totally cleaning out one claim and moving your whole operation to another is something that takes a lot of work but when you are done feels really great. I would fully recommend this game and also recommend the dlc packs that are avaliable as they add meaningful content to the game.

With that being said I do have a few things on my wishlist for this game.
1) Multiplayer, how cool would it be to run an excavator with your friends lined up in dump trucks ready to fill, or processing concentrate while others are digging for more pay dirt.
2) Mod support. I have been digging in mostly the same manner for the last 100 hours or more and mods could add different machines that make it feel fresh or different in some way.
3) More machinery/wash plant/claim options. I know the developers are adding more options through dlc at a semi regular pace but I would like to see so much more.

Having played this game for nearly 260 hrs i have to say its got good, and not so good things about it. I like the fact i can start the game, and basically turn my mind off for a period of time while i dig, dump, process, repeat. Which leads to the not so good.... dig, dump, process, repeat, and repeat, and repeat.  I've gotten to the point in the game where money isn't an issue. ( Not cheating, persay.) I did have the "everything is 1$ option turned on, and while it make the initial stage a bit less stressful, it also can ruin some of the challenge.  
  Using the SAME equipment, the Same setup, the same procedure at each claim gets old the longer the game is played. The occasional breakdown breaks up the grind, but only slightly, as repairs are a royal PITA.  Each "season" seems to run into the next the longer the game is played. 
  Some Would be Nice item: Obviously new/different equipment would be WONDERFUL to bring new life into the game. Also, improving the Dozer, and even the Excavator would be great too. Being able to purchase different buckets, or even a bigger excavator. Adding a claim that give the ability to customize the setup of the processing plant would be FANTASTIC! 
   Lastly, while multi-player is not likely, this game has a TON of multi-player potential, and would absolutely benefit from it. 
   In summation, I recommend this game to those who require the ability to quickly save/pause a game to run after a child, or perform a "Honey Do" task.  Is it perfect? No. Is it horrible? Far from it.  I whole heartedly look forward to what the Devs have planned for this game, and hope it has a bright future.

I wouldn't recommend this game and here is why and what i think would make it recommendable.

The major thing with this game is you have to do everything yourself ( solo mining ), even if you employ workers you still have to physically do all the mining.
This is dig the soil , fill the dumper , drive the dumper and tip it , take out all the moss and clean it , make sure your equipment is repaired and has fuel, basically do every little job all by yourself.
Even farming sim has helpers that will do some of the jobs for you so i can't see why this game has none of it.

You can own / lease 1 or 10 claims its your choice but with the workers only giving you little buffs instead of doing jobs for you there is no point in owning or lease more than 1 claim.

The game gets boring very fast simply because of the amount of work you have to do for little reward.

If you like real grinding games and all you play for is to grind doing the same thing over and over again then this game is for you.

What would make this game better imo.

Workers actually do some jobs which would leave you free to do other jobs, for example if  a worker is assigned to the excavator then that worker will do the digging for you ( mark an area for them to dig and away they go, would only dig if a dumper is close enough for them to fill ).

Workers could have more than 1 skill so you could assign them to another job.

here is a list of jobs workers i think could do without being impossible.

Excavator : Worker digs an area marked out by the player , Worker only digs when a dumper is close enough for them to fill, one dumper is filled worker stops until a dumper with some space to fill is returned.

Sluice : once a sluice is full worker shuts down the plant to remove the moss from the sluices , For the worker to do this you will need some sort of container that will hold all the mats close to the sluices. Once you have taken the moss away and cleaned and returned them back to the spot, the worker replaces the mats and fires the plant back up.

Bulldozer : same as Excavator the player marks an area which they want stripping or ripping.

These are just 3 jobs i feel workers could do without causing to many problems in the game.
The more experienced the worker the faster they do the job.
